blessed estate wherinto entred may euery day best manner remedie least wise weaken diminish may also behold liberty prerogatiues haue christ certaintie god loue deliuerance feare great euill day peace comfort faith blessednes estate daily inioy therefore men haue priuiledges either cast downe needeles feare possessed earthly vaine reioycing destitute incouragement walke forward heauenly coursethe fruite benefit true christian may mery lord yet without lightnes sad heauie heart owne sin abomination land yet without discouragment dumpishnes resting beleeuing god without bold presumption fearing owne weaknes yet without dreadfull deadly despayring thus christian man faithful indeede may carrie himselfe course may haue thought purpose reuolt turne hope set perswaded infinitly incouraged hold constantly therein might come way contrarie vngodly may see blessed comparison themselues goe voyde might inioywhat vngodly may learne therefore may seeke become almost altogether christian second point reason setting say haue set themselues full resolute purpose passe day godly midst many encombrances walke lord far fraile flesh may obtained weake euer owne perswasions say desire treatise mine helpe assistance speake plainely would faine doe wellthe first yet cannot tell may hereby eased relieued yet superstitionthe author desire might profit hypocrisie prophanenes yet darknes desire partaker thereof also like aduice instruction written beleeuers willing depart wicked crooked cursed way haue walked farre enuying blessing although set directly yet may vnderstand willing mind haue vndertaken worke good christ alreadie like readie helpe forward thinke know themselues yet stranger christ altogether reioyce might vnderstand haue moued hereby brother become true disciple christthis worke especially tendeth better good indeede haue laboured much perswade returne miserie become penitent many example like reason moue plentifully plainely good order extant among alreadie know part profit writing doe regarde take good preaching yet shall haue best aduice end haue alreadie truth heart conuerted vnto lord vnfainedly called backe former lust ignorance fashion world sometime framed gospellesay ezech ioh truth glad riding whereof onely able set libertie conscience strangled threat terrible curse law truth make free sauiour saith men free deede whereas may obiected doe author booke open wrong saying ioyneth gospell law readeth may finde speaketh iesus christ giuen father world many might saued promise say teacheth law without gospell answere doth indeede mention promise hebrues author booke rest religion doth flatly deny therefore cleere doth teach gospell neither booke doth plainely soundly guide wandring soule seeth selfe lost finde remission sinne euerlasting life people god doe acquainted confidence maintained daily good conscience particular action regarded one day another thinke enough sometimes haue care neither let looke repell strict vnder pretence vnderstand vse make namely let hinderance diuell raiseth vp hold backe course life practise set downe helpe better know many others thereby shall indeuour direct life take heede wayes shall god word taught shall breake many lettes yet shall strongly hold backe hinder men fift part shew season withdrawne godly course yet shall finde helpes remedy recouer againe little ease otherwise difficultie hearten incourage godlines make christian life easie shall see great light finde exceeding force therein stirre vp goe forward mightily fainting shall moued obiections cauils fleshly reason shall reade seuenth part comfort experience shall partly enioy alreadie partly hope expect afterwards shall make vanish away smoke although otherwise able hurt sting fier due consideration whole shall see blessednes manifold good thing part hath alreadie shall afterwards inioy life come shall see infinit cause hath praise god portion hath rather beautified blessed fauour grace many whereby may walke comfortably vale misery god kingdome thus aduise thee good reader know shall best thee bestow thy trauel booke wherein appoint thee certaine time houres seeing would profit cannot spend time alike exercise know booke tendeth teach thee practise thy knowledge know onely haue gathered together one thing dispersedly contained many therefore respect ouer besides ordinarie reading holy scripture thou maiest bestow time thy leasure permit considering twice reading booke practise enough lastly seeing whole matter herein contained serue thee stand thee steed setting thee direction gouerne thy whole life thou must thinke thy labour time much though thou beest occupied many yeares together much fruite shall greater longer thou hast exercised yet thy labour lesse yea easie pleasant shalt thou grow better acquainted vse one word make thy life sweet sauorie thou couldest looke happie hereafter euer reade therefore onely able report thou hast found especially finde thine owne doe teach setled daily gouernment doctrine drawne word offereth thee thou maiest see god setting forth hath directed reade quiet teachable meeke spirit desirous labour bring thee rather curious head carpe cauill censure thou dost practise follow dramme grace better pound censorious wittines remember naturall gift faculty soules sanctified goe make thee see thy selfe inwardly outwardly trained vp god family heart must well seasoned well thy whole life well ordered till thou findest many thriftie person doth outward estate namely diet ordinarie sometime feasting cheere poore man trauell paine hath brought passe hee thinkes estate good pleaseth exceedingly well labour thou thy spirituall worke seruing god finde gaine thriuing therein thou maiest make thy soule ioyfull euery day great peace god sometime thou scarcely haddest obtained weeke month grace prerogatiue thou mayest make much thou hast looke backe remember thankes vnfained farre thou hast little hope thou haddest obtaining thou wert easily mastered thy sinnes passion know must cost many prayer grone yet without shall partaker richard rogers svmme seaven treatise content euery chapter first treatise sheweth true child god chap summe assurance fauour till death vnlesse speciall reuelation error papist side carnall protestant thinke easie many thinke hard question professe gospell doubt saluation notwithstanding sauiour christ vncertaintie though cleaue vnto many deare vnto lord yet counted error sinne must brought staied iudgement thus thinke either changeablenes god much owne enemy meanes error fill liues vncomfortablenes depriue themselues hereby assurance god loue strongest perswasion true godlines great many doubt erronious opinion matter shall appeare resolution whereof though many thing must said yet matter selfe may cleerely soundly set downe word end therefore like many see farre differing god thought man haue said al haue receiued doctrine may haue eye daily easie familiar manner confirme god hath made able onely transgression adam vnnaturall treacherous rebellion disobedience whereof hee iustly guiltie adam hath part stand fall another riseth euen infection power member soule bodie poyson put cup wine doth make deadly dispersing selfe like manner corruption concupiscence first sinne adam spread ouer posteritie doth poyson whole natureeuery part corrupted sound part found crowne head sole foot hence vnderstanding euen excellentest power mind vnderstanding ephes filled blindnes darknes sauoureth thing god conscience wounded seared defiled way conscience cor heb neuer soundly peaceable memorie himselfe whatsoeuer doth wheresoeuer becommeth wrath anger god followeth accompanieth cursed field cursed house cursed basket deut store moses speaketh creature wherein take repast delight saying cursed earth thy sake gen thornes brier shall bring foorth vnto thee hence come dearth famine penurie pouertie euery cried bodie sicknesse disease many kind ache griping swelling burstings paine intolerable sens deafnes blindnes numnes like make heart quake tremble heare named friend kindred wife child father mother whatsoeuer may thought men wont take greatest pleasure delight man heart soundly pleasant vnto mixed sauce lord accurseth hee bring iudgement euen enioying whereto haue right lawfull libertie intitled christ heire lord allheb sword hanging point downward ouer man head sitting royall banquet pleasure could hee take varietie dainty another manner slaying man oft one houre hee must constrained feare remember thinke moment take thy soule thee goeth neere men heart oughtmen shift while haue one obiection water quench force heate men say miserable estate except one wearie liues make delight vnpleasant vnwise obiectthis curse moued nothing see outward eye voyce another vnder wrath god therefore let man deceiue himselfe god mocked ought affect heart heareth shall see hereafter hee hardneth heart hearing feeleth neither seeeth thing shall surely come euill greater world hardned heart past feeling remorse fall vtter desperation without recouery thing madnes frensie heap like thing thought full horror wofull man vnder none hath brought himselfe depth may impression doctrine law preached lesse sensible partie feeles print seale eye soft waxe let say counted meane common mercie deede meanly accounted doctrine common oft taught said faith luk sonne man commeth shall finde rare world sort wee may say rare men know vnder wrath god till sonne god make free doe beleeue indeede euen owne case oh men shunne death yet without beleeuing life beleeue personally owne part could lay heart whole power thereof taken vp cogitation v sudden hearing heauie newes yea power minde heart would affected euen man sting adder pricked point sword say doth vnfainedly beleeue owne miserie without exception casting away deluding conceit might hinder sudden alteration shall worke farre euer hee itact liuely set foorth example three thousand conuerted peter sermon estate crucified christ euen present time mocker railers apostle saying drunken new wine yet sudden lord arrested word challenge spirituall sword peter skilfull handling wounded striken could scape resist power stroke pricked hart arrow pierced liuer cry immediatly paine felt within intolerable expressed word made mone euen vnto lately railed vpon speaking new tongue admirable men brother shall wee doe euen thus sort doth lord worke hee maketh giue credit thundring voyce law arraigning men sinnes lesse fearefull roaring lion yet men whose sinnes great haue good cause feared faint vnder burthen whit mooued thereat moued say commonnes fowles afraid scarcrow haue long accustomed time dare sit vpon head plucke strawes nose thereof doe stand vpon make point cleere haue obserued long experience grossely people age doe suffer themselues bewitched matter bewaile soone healed pricked fall deadly raging minister heart vexed hearing daunger say bewaile estate yet third sort number hundred one neuer troubled conscience sinne woe hath purchased neither doe dreame thing needfull eate drinke sleepe playmatth worke day noah imbrace present euill world prophane merrie yea lighthearted siam iames saith houle mourne though feared would make men beleeue doe neuer scared till time houre death deadly daunger haue called lustily men banquet meane haue taken pleasure liued therein say see reckoning day account neere doe mirth become oh die nabal fooles heard shuld die stone blocke despaire iudas die died sooner needed well loued life best sort spoken prophet haue band death die quietly perhaps lord haue mercie v regarding blessing lifepsalm luk farre death therefore dying without repentance let feared yet world full people haue said behold yet wanted something make repentedbut vvithout gospell obtained pardon sinnes indeede preach law alone without glad tidings gospell vrge repentance without incouragement god mercie christ forgiuenes sinnes worthie sharply reproued bee restrained till amend dangerous error grieuous fault finde fault ioyning together experience scripture doe shew kinde preaching profit doe good church earnestly desired doe ignorance againe haue said scripture yeeldeth many complaint cry god seruants acknowledged much escaped daunger former woe1 tim paul timothie doth testifie blasphemer persecutor oppressor time distresse ieremy ierem iudg sam heard ephraim complaining thus conuert lord el cannot conuerted sam many god thanked although many thousand haue liued former age yet hath left vnwitnessed many age fallen asleepe others remaine amongst v vnto day bitter complaint salt teares dolefull groanes lesse sensibly iacob sorrowed thought wild beast deuoured sonne ioseph gen haue confessed depth woe sighing seeking meanes might finde ease deliuerance although hardned bee brought abasement obiectionand haue said purpose perswade men thinke say lesse beleeued regarded seeing many great sinner others merie least farre wound sting conscience man would thinke like depth miserie let know haue little take comfort thatansvvere haue said neither know beleeue lie ignorance vnbeliefe therefore neither suspect feare thing world vntill haue knowledge law paul sheweth till law reuealed saith rom aliue lawe thought myselfe perfect safetie euen ignorance say vnbeliefe haue sayd lieth dead man thousand dreameth feared matter furthered vnskilfulnesse carelesnesse minister lord watchman awake people deepe deadly sleepe yet haue ofttimes healed hurt daughter god people sweete word saying peace peace peace ierem loue labour faithfull teacher haue wisely plied followed may seene otherwise ye may find many though take good thereby haue knowledge beleeue thing bewrayeth blindnes bondage rest almost whole world would laugh mocke doctrine make al beleeue matter haue bin long proceede next point shew god worketh saue hath brought thus farre second worke consult case doe seeth doctrine hee hath heard case standeth namely guiltie god eternall punishment wrath seeth escape hanging ouer lord directeth guideth heart enter consideration himselfe present estate consulteth doe extremitie neither doth lightly houerly many hath heard necessitie dutie taught earnestly vrged vnto mindeth seriously goeth matter life death god thus moueth deliberate weightie doubtfull case man neede call question nothing well done without earthly matter moment wit man chiefe agent dealer know rashnes doth nothing well much may think god suffer meaneth bring great honour assured hope saluation goe without due regard consideration especially dealing ordinary meanes may come entreth consultation doeierem euident prophet ieremy saith vehement complaint people called repentance prophet waited see fruit follow none said haue done none entred consultation matter therefore said prodigall sonneluk resembleth rightly sinner returning home father resembleth penitent sinner turning god come himselfe say many hired seruants father house haue bread enough die hunger thing consider deliberate best doe steward questioning himselfe doe hee warned giue account stewardship doth plainly teach besides hath said godly fallen could repent remembred considered fall fallen reade church ephesusreuel peter wept bitterly remembred word iesus transgressed vpon consideration let v doubt god draweth consult estate doe anguish distresse mind may looke little good come casting downe sorrow law conceiued doe serious manner able case requireth thinke deliberate therfore god watcheth ouer able counsel themselues yet lord guide aske counsell others forementioned example act woman samaria doth teach manner hee doth thought hath hard coniecture euen estate mentioned scripture doe testifie namely doe whether bee hope hee bewitched come estatethe complaint penitent sinner hath lost depriued himselfe estrangement god following seeking owne foolish libertie seeth end come cursed race hath runne little time hath yet remaining also full soone gone delight iests merrie conceit dreames vaine hope hee long life promotion increase rich good cheere companion like ala gone ashamed thinke deceiueable pleasure safetie sound peace seeth farre seeth former life called account alreadie although thinketh delay excuse vaine shift deceiuing himselfe yet seeth cannot put away deadly remembrance wofull estate especially hee considereth god mocked word frustrate hath bewraied miserie therefore consult longer flesh bloud hath done putteth away fleshly carnall shift hold god gracious direction taketh counsell knowledge hee hath considereth man come christ heauenly father draw spirit therefore although sorrow hypocrite vanisheth away commeth nothing yet god gracious working becommeth occasion humbling breaking heart vnto much good hereafter wee shall see also considereth god slow anger readie forgiue sinner gracious full mercie though thought repelled remembrance greatnes sinne vnacquaintednes promise yet doubt secretly vpholden dreadfull despayre thus present comfort faileth sorroweth still deeply thinketh verely hath part therfore cut way time cannot returne think desolation woful condition breedeth deepe sigh sorrowes afresh breaking foorth one full hold longer wring strong cryes oh miserable man shall doe shall escape fearefull vengeance heauines accuseth himselfe complaineth auoide miserie seeth impossible go vnder still feeles intolerable although knoweth remedie yet many heauines abasement doe dimmely weakly know therefore sorrow yet apply himselfe meanes extremitie therefore streight distresserom crieth paul wretched man shall deliuer therefore lord guideth instructour hee paul ananias act stayeth publike ministerie owne knowledge bringeth wee reade prodigall child luk counsell himselfe hath heard third worke broken hearted humbled former consultation god working bringeth resolution looke backe old sodom hard condition soeuer go vnder falleth relenting heart broken humbled abased spirit meeknes saithluk paul cast act lord wilt thou haue doe seeth lord hath aduantage man bound chaines readie attendant whatsoeuer pleaseth stiffenecked stubbornnes neither entreated commaunded feared vnfained humbling himselfe god want breach wound conscience beginning goodnes grace man feeleth himselfe casteth pride strength high minde knowledge religion good gift soeuer man hath without humilitie vnreformed vnmortified happie discipline nurture wondred soone suddenly breake clod hard heart easily winde twigge wand whether listeth could great tree least manner bowed thus must lord worke shew wisedome power vpon vnframed crooked person made right straight perhaps say man neerer god kingdome sight knowledge redemption forementioned miserie answere much euery manner way thus humbled easily perswaded spirit god enlightened whereby cast downe heauines feare fit thinke remember sweete promise god though heard yet saw nothing doe therfore durst hearken thinke preaching sometime heard one may hope better god nature may entreated reconciled fourth worke secret desire forgiuenes consideration raiseth vp himselfe lord kindleth especiall desire forgiuenes sinnes fauour god cannot right well ordered proceede hope god entreated therefore setteth eye cleerely could nature god louing kinde readie pardon great sinner might easily dismaied haue found fauour also god good directing much helping forward remembreth none exempted benefitmatth matth matth exempt themselues brused reede especially shall broken contrite heart despised heauie laden comming shall eased mourne shall comforted blessed alreadie although ignorance ill building vp many farre thought affection long time diuell working vpon weaknes god disposeth also euen haue best meanes helpes set forward may feele see owne weaknes time yet doth worke thing one time purpose saue feruent desire meane though timorousnes hungring mercie god stirreth vp earnest longing remedie christ feruent man appointed death setteth pleasure gaine world comparison pardon without cannot haue ioy thing poore sinner feeling terrour god curse knowing release christ hauematth luk shall saued haue shall perish euerlastingly doth aboue thing world sigh longing bee made partaker hunger therfore thirst pardon welcome think shall good tidings vnto man low brought abased owne eye farre hope worldly remedie either might staied word comfort time acceptable like bee vnto much welcome doubtlesse promise gospell haue euer thing world besides hee might haue coursest diet would sweete sauourie hony combe prou matth luk pleasant nay crummes vnder table comfortable refreshings glutted childrens dainty oh glad one would might receiued heauely father hired seruant could brought like place sonne could bring tidings righteousnes messenger sent god tell god mercifull offence iob thinke vpon sinnes vnto odde man one thousand heare iesus christ hath vanquished sinne death diuell power ouer brought light immortalitie life hath giuen perfect righteousnes couer shame make comely well fauoured sight god hereby fully reconciled againe former disgrace anguish minde deadly thraldome abandoned thinke welcome thought man case mentioned filled miserie top toe knowing hide himselfe seeing go vnder burthen griefe would make reckoning message man thirsting almost death refuse drinke one place execution reiect pardon among thought least profitable god enableth fasten vpon laying estate paire ballance seeth hope mercie certaine condemnation lying still estate wherin hath liued cannot appeare god iudgement seate otherside considering god calling sinner repentance giuing son redeeme euen great offender may king niniueh said haue mercie vpon hope suing seeking humility remorse vnto god thus lord still bringeth whereas case hasteth sorrow meanes may either break hath humbled wrought effect long remedy deliuerance el ouercome yet soule poore sinner god meaneth saue meekned humbled waiteth till god doth stay vphold continued sigh desire bright beames fauour christ might shine vpon desiring aboue al thing vnburthened woe pardon sin yet hath power perhaps pray soule feruently desireth like manner hath bin said consultation resolution mind thus deliberateth casteth though case able expresse meaning yet could vtter conceiueth would say thought consideration himselfe estate although affirme able applie remedie himselfe yet generall hope hee hath found promise god kind mercifull broken hearted sinner doth cause stay may perhaps resolueth vnfainedly full purpose goe forward seeking forgiuenes sinnes god hand way take perisheth perisheth yet hope hath resoluing himselfe neuer walke former deadly estate confesse lay foorth long continued wickednes vnto lord though himselfe neither spare himselfe wherein hath pleased owne heart seeth vaine desire therefore resolute neuer turne yet well instructed maketh purpose forsaking sinne meanes iustification detestation former wickednes moued drawne god doe resoluing therefore one steppe degree passeth vnto fuller certaintie happines seeketh hath receiued great measure grace fauour hath attained therfore sathan knoweth holdeth men many strong cord although bee long yet faint chapman bidding still ware would haue yet buy euen doe haue well counselled make haste seeking lord best yet profit pleasure friendship feare holdeth backe although heate haste sore driuen sicknes tempest feare death like occasion doe rashly purpose protest neuer men haue yet doe day like bulrush wind therefore farre truth speake hath neerely deeply looked estate haue done say cannot drawne backe former loosenes licentiousnes holden kept longer torture well knoweth none like terrible asked better resoluing end may cleerely appeare answere wrought heart mollified humbled softned paul hee saw god set himselfe going damascus persecute saint threw groundacts said lord wilt thou haue doe brought point heart full relenting sorrow displeasing god finisheth whole worke receiuing christ doth middle part thus bow bend man heart neither doth god spirit onely hammer breaking brusing clod also doth leade fift worke confesse aske pardon holie faith least without resisting doctrine yet yea attaine power faith neither declare worke thereof bee either feele neede within themselues whereby driuen seeke helpe themselues christ doe sustaine smart lay burthen vpon neuer sought cared need pincheth beleeue say indeede staied confident faith liues reformed serue tongue lip follow owne lust heart staggering still betwixt hope doubt blush truth certaintie promise benefit reape thereby although strong fighting lowd cryes depth sorrow combat sathan yet giue ouer yeeld right hand one perill drowning taketh hold naked sword though cut deepe rather yeeld life water chuse keepe faith great difficulty rather giue ouer soule vpholden onely thereby diuels hand themselues perdition whereupon heare speech testifying sore conflict betweene sathan themiob psalm although thou kill lord yet trust thee though walke middest vale death yet forsake thee appeareth god world wont cast mist onely eye best euen attempteth sore take away light faith hee doth keepe altogether god hath taught hand warre finger fight psalme skill want foyled none beguiled sathan wilfull foolishand thus hath said let learne know none kept voide destitute fruite gospell beleeuing vnto saluation willingly put neckes sathans yoke contented bee depriued crowne righteousnes life owne follie while others wise meanes let goe end euery sort may see themselues glasse seuerall let haue thought good set briefly particularly least many whereby hindred diuell imbracing beleeuing promise life listparticular let faith may see held backe happines peace briefly thinke impossible psalm first thinke impossible assured saluation life therefore seeke necessarie matth others think possible necessary men busie themselues obtaining keeping may saued without much adoe pleasure wil meanes forgoe contrariwise must suffer reproch affliction child godheb luk therefore looke promise life come esau presume ioh others presumptuous selfeloue perswade themselues doe beleeue iere others though grosse offender neuer broken hearted sight sinne miserie therefore doctrine faith cannot enter feare continuance act ioh others thinke though begin yet shall neuer continue hold godly course el doe take offence way therefore neuer goe hauing begun soone reuolt againe slightly seeke it9 others say comfortable thing know selues bee child god hope speake well gospel glad heare briefly stirre vp aduise good way haue made good entrance may see take heede imbrace seeke faith meanes manner haue set downe little strengthen haue attained true measure wherein marked highly commended good desire naked bare desire saluation stirred vp men beleeue many thinke although without ground seeing haue desire sometime part god doth make beleeuers men voide little hope conceiued therefore shew helpe doe anything looke true happines desire ought whereto groweth true sincere may deceiue may finde many haue sometime desired earnestly yet neuer obtained balaam man could hardly haue shewed difference betwixt desiring desire haue attained indeede instant time hath appeared sudden short continuance failed obtained sought gospell said haue ioyed desired heare mat true desire giues ouer vanished whereas desire cannot satisfied without mourneth longeth pineth sorrow thing commeth way weaken hope conceiued till bee remoued hindred benefit therfore must know desire sometime fleeting somtime faint must become feruent constant parable pearle may seenematth soone found value knowne skilfull merchant neuer rested till gotten owne wee must know thus desireth forcibly drawne hereunto god hath shewed great neede shall gaine thereby hath prepared made fit receiue otherwisehigh account god draw men valuing account desire worke god spirit strengthened hereby namely hee prizeth valueth according worthines farre able say thus account farre surmounteth excelleth world whatsoeuer account esteemeth pretious treasure beleeue hee knoweth beleeueth deare vnto god shall saued luk must faith assurance eternall life valued indeed2 pet shall finde blessing cause peter calleth pretious faith esteeme thus better profit pleasure preferment must needes thinke praying hearing word worketh questioning trauaile labour meditating promise whereby spirit god writeth heart say must needes thinke paine well bestowed seeking yea infinitly recompenced though hath long manner fareth weake beleeuers yet shall haue experience sinceritie carematth keepe good conscience longer continuance time shall well fully setled faith great contentment comfort thus conclude let measure weake owne weaknes first beginning thinke gift faith excellent cannot great helpe yeelded weake directing come concerning first therefore although haue sundrie token shewed child god euery faithfull christian may iudge himselfe hereby yet want experience vehemencie temptation cannot boldly confidently rest stay themselues generall doctrine applie themselues meane weake christian yet haue attained communion brother faith godlines therefore though aforementioned property true beleeuers may cleerely seene discerned bee themselues also confesse haue staied saue temptation oftentimes haue found singular comfort christ desire much yet soone driuen hold caused suspect comfort vaine fancie fall much feare doubting none lord must know therefore seeing shadow changeablenes god owne weaknes think prophet confesseth himselfe like casepsal long wrestled stroue temptation hath assuredly perswaded god loue toward time whole life ought cast away confidence afterheb suffer himselfe depriued chief treasurethe first perswasion vphold weake faith though may stay weake conscience sometimes afflicted sort yet say seeing hee cannot satisfied till doubtfulnes might seeketh subdue remoued soule set libertie againe new light god promise therefore perswaded labouring groaning rest wearied heauie heart cannot miscarry forsaken lord lowest depth distressethe second perswasion vphold vveake faith one testimonie propertie new birth shall euer found although hee alwaies feeleth neither perceiueth himselfe whereby shall manifest liueth god life god euen hearing breathing mouing feeling like infallible token life bodie many likelihood appeareth dead owne iudgement seemeth hope cut rage diuell strength temptation yet man suddenly striken downe ground violent blow amazed yet afterward recouereth himselfe againe euen feeleth hath faith life yet without seeing hee without worke spirit alwaies accompanieth although indeede hath neede especiall strong comfort mine answere bee enough thou wilt marueile god doth thus deale thee suffer thee fall depth doubting sorrow feare although loueth thee yea thou hast felt comfort thy conscience must make mine answere full large satisfying thee herein say therfore although wise prouidence god many truly begotten child therefore haue sound comfort christ doe fall sometimes dangerously greatly wauer doubt oftentimes become vncomfortable lord disposeth least sudden chaunge damnable vncomfortable estate happie ioyfull bee lifted vp conceited become secure presumptuous forerunner cause fearefull fall yet certaine ought thus part haue said weaknes must withstood ouercome attaining whereto occasion doubting hath beleeued must searched remoued ordinarily infirmitie neglect dutie sleightnes manner performing particular sin also pronenes sinne nourishing strength long lying therein whereupon tender conscience feareth former comfort deceitfull vaine doubteth owne estate right remouing hereof duly bee considered roote comfort christ strength christian lifea third perswasion vphold weake faith weaknes herein ought breed doubting saluation christ much comfort standeth god iustifieth vngodly hath freely giuen sonne reconciled v heartily desire fauour hauing enemy hath gospell called v spirit wrought heart sure perswasion hereof wherby dead sin made aliue god new borne therefore begin chaunged first affection conuersation little little therefore haue assurance new birth though v much weakenes spirituall life yet ought doubt whether god child seeing new borne neuer die rather wee remember first wee childrenthe fourth perswasion vphold weake faith therefore weake secondly subiect many spirituall disease take away sense life therefore wee must seeke cured despaire life certaine perish see haue turned hart christian course offended god haue suffered selues seduced manner way must despaire doubt safetie whole person one part member distempered ill ease cure ita fit simile labour restore health againe thine heart thine eye thy hand part hath offended resort thou phisition christ iesus make thy complaint thou art heauie wouldest faine returne againe whence thou art fallen confident owne promise sake calleth stretched armes saying returne thou wandrest esai matth thou wouldest finde ease comfort come vnto refresh thee beleeue satisfie thee thou hungrest haue fallen offended god may turne home againe first husband good welcome shall much beloued therefore comforted haue prouoked onely held downe feare infirmitie thus hauing answered doubt sort god people weak faith purposed haue proceeded deale haue seale god marked eternall life haue disclosed packe counterfeit haue proued many say christian elect god doe lie nothing lesse child god weakest faith must depriued priuiledge thinke ye lord must glozing hypocrite suffered conceiue false opinion hope none dreame happines say purposed next haue entred meane commeth minde occasion haue answered alreadie faithfull hauing receiued much comfort hope effectuall callinganother sort weake faith comforted haue yet troubled doubtings occasion say called mind another sort god deare seruants weaker deeplier grieued therefore tenderly regarded least brused reedes altogether broken smoking flaxe vtterly quenched hauing manifest signes faith new birth yet subtill cruell malice diuell although without wise disposing lord great good example others brought bondage perswaded vtter reprobate haue remedie desperation feele say wrath god kindled soules anguish conscience intolerable finde release notwithstanding barely shake terrifie afflicted yet melancholie shall herewithall possesse partie made farre grieuous raiseth excesse distrust feare perswadeth selfe miserie cause seate diuell apt instrument weaken doctor bright phisition anno vnto also may referre former point say deeply touched conscience sinne alone may comforted deliuered seeing appertaining matter haue taken hand say somewhat thereof wrath god neither anger kindled feare oppresseth estate owne feeling euen worst haue sinned holy ghost sinne onely able shut hope saluation yet many temptation thinke haue proue haue committed sinne may appeare haue maliciouslie set themselues truth gospell god wilfullie persecuted conscience doe imbrace heartily loue able denie meere delusion temptation diuell holdeth terror bondage time discouer lay open themselues shall hereafter plainely see discerne many like case haue found end though temptation enimie purposed confusion yet louing mercifull father triall faith patience vertues indeed ground hereof owne weakenes said former sort god child vpon diuell worketh although wring hope shall neuer able doe yet wearie liues heauines discomfortsathan worketh vpon v suggestion infirmitie sathan doth sometime assaie without meanes onely spirituall suggestion sometime meanes outward occasion euill forcible perswasions sinne rebellion god first two certaine personall manner soule though bodilie shape eye without meanes outward thing tempteth v secret thought heart spirit creation excellent hath accesse vnto spirit trouble disorder action see corporall creature corporall bodilie force annoy one another spirit long experience hath corruption miserie age age giueth knowledge mind perfectlie gathereth least signe inclination knoweth heart proper god long acquaintance nature conceiueth intent purpose oftentimes without signification either speech gesture thus able discouer vanitie mind knowledge vniuersall corruption seeth occasion whereto incline suggesteth temptation sinne disobedience two adde malice called enuious man naught vnsearchable subtiltie exceeding strengthsathans property greater rest hurteth least appeareth least suspect cause said hee changeth himselfe angell light cor shall meruaile though without meanes outward occasion raiseth great terror dismaidnes especiallie lord giuing leaue doe good v exercised besides thatsathan tempteth perswadeth sin delight inticed sometime sinnes nature loue also especiallie thus brought low anguish bitternes soule tempted euils strange abhor least conceite finde least part nature incline though otherwise complaine great frailtie haue thought blaspheme god tempted lay violent hand others moued thereto hate malice deuoure selues dispaire distrust god mercie grace sinnes partie hath neuer delight hee yet ouertaken sinnes heart drawne indeed yet feared guiltines thosehe laboureth dimme knowledge sight god grace v euer loathed diuell fasten vpon weake person wise especiallie laboureth better thing reprobate moued stirre vp weake faith haue desire good meanes counsell reading like hath stricken deadly blow conscience god hath forsaken spoken diuels tempting child god pleaseth lord triall without helpe outward meanes occasion worke purposed speake end helpe sometimes deceiued oppressed manner fit place satisfie would glad know matter proceede therefore draw end herein doth oft without meanes deepely fasten vpon weake conscience god people feare dismay doth much easilie helpe outward meanes hath couered heart darkenes brought dreadfull feare god wrath plucked armour themhe troubleth much outward obiects whereby resisted holdeth vantage euery thing made matter increase distressed estate therefore see knife thought destroy themselues goe water vehemently perswaded drowne themselues tempted strangle themselues either place giue occasion instrument wherewith doe see merry heauines increased seeing say shall neuer come deadly sorrow dispaire see dogge wish eate meate thinke wil increase damnation dare scarcely take meanest scrap relieue nature scripture recited themthe obiections weake temptation oh belongeth say past hope whatsoeuer answere neuer fit doe good yet neuer satisfied raise new obiections themselues nothing satisfied spoken infinite set downe speech thought like vnto haue mentioned diuell draweth occasion worketh see owne letting goe hold god promise mercy christ yet sometime haue imbraced felt great comfort least could deny part vnspeakeable goodnes god vtterlie swallowed vp kept secret grace though seene deare seruants plunged depth distrust dispaire might one comfort counsell another discouragement eueryside attributed sathan want subtiltie readines hurt ablenes malice crueltie either one sort preserued freed like measure languishing feare senselesse sicknes disease age farre dangerous bold securitie presumption haue said lord keeping neither meruaile v though marked vnbeleeuers lord hath eye euer vpon beloued one dauid speaketh psalm may see hurt befall euen mother hath eye alwaies young child beginneth goe get knock conclude ye aske remedy vsed sore assault first say seeing conscience beare witnes much taken glorie offending god say let marke soone fit heare rather count proceede themselues altogether contrarie former conuersation nature selfe haue enforcement inticement himfurther remedy consider much doth displease god remoued faith giue place spirit error therefore gather godly boldnes confidence one side strength sathan side god calleth incourageth v trust beleeue standing need thereof would gladly say case imbrace promise made christ iesus hinder v lord iustifie cleare v shall condemne v neither let still obiecting feele small strength faith hope many god deare child doe thereby enemie may take great encouragement owne disaduantage feele sweete taste thereofwhat wee doe feele sweete taste god mercy sometime felt shall iudge therefore themselues vtterly bereaued thereof soule sicke tasteth sweete meates consolation wont therefore alwaies measure themselues presently feele soule hath lost taste rather time past prophet example teacheth like case whilest stoode free disease vnderstanding much altered sathans terrours fittest place alleage strong faith woman canaan christ seemed giue repulse vtterly yet would moued faith firie dart thrust three foure one another say obiections like sort haue said reason thus themselues liue god child doe holily god requireth therefore cannot haue comfort haue reprobate haue grace want would haue ought considera sixt perswasion vphold weak faith lord plant take full perfection according nature plant require daily watering dressing whereby end attaine full growth christ oh feele testimonie god spirit might assure answere neither doe god child time feele may see owne frailtie god doth hide himselfe sometime season mother doth child try affection may earnest desire mourne god wonted grace haue obtained againe may ioyfulnes heart praise yet god doth withhold comfort many timesdeut walke heauily could giue credit vnto may assure themselues may liue safetie vnder protection day long owne frailtie vehemencie temptation oppresseth thema seuenth perswasion diminisheth feeling thereof patience constancie resolute mind beare god triall bring good end yea meeke going vnder god hand shall learne experience afterward wade thorough greater yet middest haue hope shall make ashamed rom thus may appeare although weake faith god deare seruants may many way assaulted saluation meanes thereof feeling doubted yet vndoubtedly lord cannot taken hand destitute faith haue proued whereby apprehend christ though weake hath brought vnto much comfort time past though season lord working good seeme farre otherwise former point second head generall part treatise weakest god people vpholden vehement temptation thus much said chap difference beleeuers none followeth second point wherein cleerer manifestation hath said must discerne former sort haue great shew faithfull one beleeuers yet nothing lesse shew weakest christian haue spoken may see estate apparantly different yet come neerest vnto beleeuers answere doubt know doe sticke mindes diuers matter first whereas may maruaile describing god child haue rested infallible markes thereof namely sorrow miserie confession sinnes god feare displeasure desiring kinde amendment life seeing also effectuallie called god answere haue followed scripture herein haue shewing lord made mention rather grace god properly belonging faithfull may hypocrite hollow hearted professor seeing finde scripture experience forenamed affection many good commendable vertues seeme may haue place doe appertaine god election man may much burthened weight sinne conscience terrified spirit bondagematth king may pensiue afterward sinne committed wish vndone afraide punishment may promise amendment walke heauily expresse outward signes yet released set free feareth person hearing promise gospell may finde ioy delight glorious tidings bringeth take sensible pleasure exercise religionmatth may haue taste life come balam may reuerence feare minister god herod numb mark begin amend fault life hee others wee reade gospell yet though fearefull thinke sealed vp saluation euen thus farre man may goe profession christian religion yet stranger power faith life godlines accompanieth meane good peaceable conscience argument much written gospell hath preached place may speake mine owne knowledge hath often handled largely thinke may say lesse neither doe speake haue said matter discourage partly driue deceiuing themselues loue stay themselues care vpon rotten hold broken staffe partly make true testimony eternall life pretiously esteemed haue without bestowe diligence seeking weakest faith findeth christ iesus lose seeing hath said breake brused reede matth quench smoking flaxe glorious shewes godlines boldest crake loude boastes faith yet indeedeluk shall vanish away ayre come nothing hauing part euen saul bragges god deliuered dauid hand shut citie frustrated owne shame sam true may appeare example mentioned scripture also liues sundry countrey haue receiued gospell ioy much cast downe force lawe humbling hath bowing themselues short time like bulrush wind ioy hath suddaine flash fleeting mirth well grounded inlightning generall knowledge saluation rather sealing assurance owne heart continuance forwardnes religion sometime many hebr exod oh many haue report made others great change gospell wrought many say haue resorted hearing giuen good commendable hope owne change also repentance yet soone wearie lord yoke subiect holy gouernment many haue forsaken fountaines water life ier could haue refreshed soules necessitie sound comfort haue digged themselues broken pit hold water comfort haue started aside like broken bowe haue returned shamefully vomit pet sowe washed wallow againe mire speake though god called life many amongst v within yeeres maiesties raigne singular hope left comfortable companie amongst v still others dailie comming onapostataes cast shame dung face haue fallen feruent desire sincere milke word worldiohn iohn prophanenes carelesnes scripture saith iudas went v none v v would haue continued still v either prosperitie hath graunted themiames haue waxen wanton haue turned grace god loosenes matth affliction hath followed haue growne wearie profession saying reade eccles former dayes better wished againe merrie world inioyed pleasant life israelite flesh pot passed ignorance godexod lust thereof superstition like haue fallen grace god haue departed yet professed themselues haue infinitly indebted benefit especially gospell seemed take small delight seasoniohn consider falsehood towards god double dealing would giue heart beleeue merciesmatth onely treasure hold fast confidence would sufficiently haue recompenced forsaking world cease meruailing although fallen high account estimation among seruants godthe fals many professor haue made vile vnto vile reprochfull estate reckoned vnbeleeuers making chiefe religion rather iudges censurers brother hold retaine loue fellowship yet cease intreate lord dailie belong would please awake bring home prodigal sonne sight haue seene reuolt onely themselues may saued though take shame world others also imboldened sinne example may reclaimed thus loue men hath constrained little go aside lamenting miserie haue knowne many hauing shined light season become mistie cloudes hinder light others also counsell consider haue driuen away holy profession persecution beensome haue fallen away trouble came might haue giuen better hope brother meere weakenesse hindered haue gone away first loue broken fellowship brother euen time gospell flourishing preached place power beginning earnestly stirred vp imbrace yea forsooke good beginning moses gone aside space fortie day whilest amongst middest tent calling vpon sound constant goe forward done long himselfe also god glorie spoken great courage cheerefulnes good example going therefore seeing sinne greater aduised looke better assurance saluation haue offended may repentlet repent take surer hold eternall life hand faith rather weake small occasion let goe feeling sinne feare sorrow distress vnfainedly humbled heart mollified resolued seeke forgiuenes thereof righteousnes thereby free imputation thereof iesus christ soundly haue disease healed sorrow doubtes expelled true comfort ministred faith would effectually haue wrought haue raised vnfained loue god againe would cause haue withdrawne rather haue set themselues growe godlines brother least manner haue returned former lust ignorance2 pet professed themselues haue purged haue written cause haue content deceiued opinion happines yet voide haue light beholding sinnes haue wounded conscience guilt punishment due haue therefore perswaded themselues haue effectually called yet haue seene found sinnes haue pardoned token thereof themselues2 cor haue changed affection conuersation haue become new creature though alleage iustly conuersion paul people mentioned act sam returning people israel god time iudges dayes samuel example holy ghost setteth downe trouble minde pricke conscience great abasing themselues graunt wrought haue truly penitent yet hath ioyned also earnest hungring god mercie vnfained faith spirit adoption sealing vp saluation vnto liuelie fruites haue beleeued god hath become louing father christ iesus fearefull iudge haue hereby inforced loue therefore1 pet seeke please heart grace haue set forward godly life bring forth fruites beseeming profession tim men furnish themselues faith pure heart good conscience change life louing god let time end griefe mind woundes conscience healed outwardly opinion sufficient repentance onely sorrowfull abiding gripe griefe yet finding sound comfort haue cast therefore affliction time time vexed returning againe neuer driuen away kindly aright shall defend themselues way thought course good thus cast downe seeing lawe preached constrained thus doe aske preached iudgements god saw meete humbledthe law preached without gospell answere first law neuer preached alone discreete teacher himselfe skilfull dutie gospell secondly law preached hold men vnder yoke feare bondage cause men see sinne cleerelyvvhy law preached thereby punishment due might come themselues truth set store god mercie christ merit onely saue soules minister comfort thirdly haue god approued wished rest workes lawe best action could doe yet faith perswasion remission sinnes truly setled haste thence speede trie themselues rule doctrine well owne experience2 cor christ might become acceptable haue heard receiued one part ministery haue placed happines repentance haue fancied knowledge god christ haue vrged haue deceiued subtiltie tempter haue sought please god feare vengeance haue found deliuerance death vndeserued fauour haue deepely pricked sinne longer holden doubtfulnes god child none haue great temptation conflict haue haue affliction bring vnto godhow men abuse affliction sathans vviles others dismaieth holdeth vnder contrarie cannot god child haue neuer deepe sorrow long lying sinne many brother haue though men example rather god word rule follow suggesteth others estate could good seeing haue liues full outward cross godly haue yet contrarie many haue long holden captiues cogitation durst thinke themselues belong god electionpsal seeing euery vnder one crosse thus diuell whose malice subtiltie doe know fewer doe well weigh fewest doe wisely carefully resist diuell say holdeth number occupied like point wherein triall happines certaintie peace doth consist religion holie doctrine doth affect seeth needes goe hence thought would neuer haue become stranger pilgrimes haue doe world needes must may truly say like euer haue considereda great grace tied vvorld exceedingly haue tied world pleasure hath v thinke haue may haue haue sought fulfill lust heart lust eye pride glorie haue thing haue loued best yea like vnto mad men wee haue nestled delighted selues yet haue certaintie abiding til morrow liberall dealing faithfull one dreamed therefore earthly minded could sauour heauenly thing onely earth since lord hath faith perswaded v fauour granted v see varietie holie heauenly delight may inioyed v christian course comparison pleasantest estate euer liued haue haue said determined selues renounce former course hold thing transitorie vainematth soone flitting away beleeuing selues al thing daily drawing end desire haue nothing hold v rather abide flesh ought admonish v keep fast willingnes die wee haue gotten wee lose againea great liberty vvilling die fit liue rather seeing alone maketh v fit liue remaine ought euen grace accompanieth faith v effectually wrought v say not1 cor wee loath benefit life god hath giuen v neither doe forsake particular calling commaunded abide forsaking world leaue necessarie duty neither condemne wee moderate care maintaining selues prouiding outward estate retaining heauenly mindes renounce corruption world lust pet prophane abuse earthly affaire dealing stand practise christianitie word god say two cause one respect lawfull yea holie desire liue namely doe good churchphil wee may ought say dauid liue die set foorth praise lord say dealing earthly affairespsal end may burdensome others performing duty particular calling action may haue proofe grace v meane patience righteousnes hope faith loue whole conuersation may bee well ordred proportionable holie duty therefore respect may willing content liue god haue wee may shew foorth vertues hath giuen v amongst men otherwise hidden could otherwise seene men possibly liue godly hath hand world meane god forbiddeth action mentioned commaunds chargeth themluk tainted neither haue conscience defiled cause say contemne life lawful liberty vpon principle falsely grounded falsly vnderstood wee forsake world diuers haue troubled many weake people abused saying teaching vnder great pretence godlines begin deuout sauour religion wee ought leaue world say depart earthly calling dealing also societie fellowship men occupied therein end greater deuotion pietie may bred vscloystring like point godlines say goe aside abbeyes frieries armetages cloysters may neither heare see dealing opinion plausible ignorant vnstable though palpable staied iudgement hath deceiued many2 cor diuell hath shewed himselfe angel light perswading kinde life highest degree holines although hath easily may proued denne depth abomination though many haue good meaning first gone apart secular affaire betaken themselues liue sequestred place would troubled earthly dealing yet subtile theeues arose afterwards popish prelacie abused horrible mischiefes must ignorant men venture without warrant longer doe fall depth sinne man gone way goeth astray till seeke come againe hath cause much wickednes hath time broke forth papacy people haue hartned monasticall life superstitious deuotion idlenes whoredome sodomitry hypocrisie cruell murthering soules many infant misbegotten digresse farre second reason made plaine meaning saying contempt world wearines life leauing affaire world forsaking particular calling though man may godly beleeuer vseth proue one may contemner world vseth consequent sure saluation faith may haue grace despise world haue set downe sixt propertie inseparable companion faith seuenth companion faith shame former vnkindnes godto proceede therefore see thus beloued one men religion siam iames boldly saith none tongue thus vngouerned shew soeuer made thereof might goe forward conuince many countrimen haue often heard god minister vrging manner sermon doe know tell truth thing indeed yet seeme religious haue said oft say griefe haue thing raigning onely owne enemy also preaching gospell christ neither reioycing good glorie faith hope yet thus earthly carnally minded must know howsoeuer beleeue god hath ioyned faith vertue godlines patience temperance beleeueth thereby turned old conuersation mine owne parttoo hastie repentance seldome sound haue long misliked haste sudden shewes great repentance men first acquaintance word preached haue professed haue repented besides gripe grief haue knowne repentance meaneth haue thought themselues able almost sudden censure yea condemne teach although boldnes enough ioyned much ignorance haue taken hand doe speake humbled heart sinne desire nothing set libertie feare oppresseth learning daily beleeue grounded therein dare otherwise beleeue sinnes forgiuen walke humbly god men passe sorrow sin without faith newnes life imaginenote neuer euer shall attained leauing learning faithchange life without faith vaine assurance god fauour beginning worker new life thing soone gotten therefore sleightly laboured seeke want thorough prouing whether haue many driuen againe seeke many yeeres thought sure yea lamented many neuer attaine vnto standeth sound reason young beginner learning trade become occupiersa simile setter vp rule well haue neuer learned obey standeth religion count themselues good christian indeede haue tasted christ benefit thereof neither learned truth put old man affection lust put new haue felt good bountifull sake readie doe thing haue spoken occasion matter hand namely faith bringeth alwaies new life much ouermatched fleshly corruption yet raiseth sighings striuings heart till subdued might least preuaile brother please themselues thinking haue faith liues filledit vaine thinke haue faith without new life many offensiue action also custome common whereas honored title god seruant must known liuerie vncorrupt life proue sauour smell good conuersation came god earth1 pet may shew himselfe man god indeed rootes must fastened tree lebanonhos must flourish lillie finde grace god dew quicken sure whatsoeuer men alleage liues cannot beare mould print sound doctrinerom yet needes goe approoued seruants god strong delusion perswadeth therefore seeing scripture doth haue said fully often set downe truth vnto v haue obtained mercy god taught guided ought men settle themselues another course time past walked deliuered great bondageluk end haue heard deliuered whereforematth assured saluation let either willingly subiect lord yoke meane commandements commit whole life gouerned diligent doe good workes else let hold peace nothing lesse time shall appeare hath done already many aretit cost well assured god slacke reuenge boldnes shut vp matter one sentence saint paul ephesian liuely describeth life led sure god fauourephes saying put lay aside concerning conuersation past old man corrupt nature power mind bodie infected deceiueable lust renued spirit mindes euen force reason greatest may put new man sanctified power body mindes may renued changed also shall ye framed bring forth righteousnesse true holinesse wherein ye shall carrie resemblance god chap leading godly life required faith temporall promise god hartie assent credit commaundements also threatnings word god well faith saued haue shewed true iustifying faith godly life must necessitie goe together one cannot without goe second point first generall head part proue necessarie leading godly life beleeue giue credit whole doctrine word god led guided thereby well haue faith promise saluation forgiuenes sinnes say thereforethe beleeuer must beleeue promise beside saluation cor beleeueth christ saluation must stay himselfe rest therein though giuen vnto v father righteousnesse make v way eternall life wisdome also make v wise sanctification make v holy also redemption deliuerance ridde v good time calamity misery befall v truly beleeueth must perswaded promise life tim life come serue confirme obedience whether great principall grace spirit smaller bodily safety preseruation danger farre shall good doe belong vnto beside must beleeuealso threat commaundements commaundements teach obedience threatnings restraine contrarie set downe particularlie well binde conscience thereunto also say must beleeuerom according saint paul whatsoeuer wise dare ieopard soule vpon truth doctrine euen looke saluation lord iesus christ euer counting sinne shall found iarre iangle either heart life though haue hope saued doe thisthe beleeuers doe thus cor yet manifest doe make conscience many sinnes looke many promise feare many threat doe much testifie well fenced might meanes hereof holde euen promise saluation selfe weakely commeth passe commonlythe cause better stablished rooted truth beleeue thing worthiest excellent plainely soundly thoroughly beaten people againe againe till willinga second haue owne another cause people haue repentance godly life begin proceede therein forward backward scarcely time setled staied although great part owne weaknes yet also respect ignorance speake better sort people haue receiued first wander vp downe vnprofitably heauily best must need doubtfull vncertaine whether wee please god whereas chiefe care least doe thing might crase cracke faith especially tender weake like bruised reede easily broken beleeuer must beleeue shall sanctifiedtherefore beleeue saued let beleeue also shall sanctified one faith beleeue shall receiue grace god bring foorth fruites amendment life shall made purpose make full matter haue entred simple know hardly conceiued exception may taken consider sauiour saith compareth himselfe vine beloued branch teach vsiohn branch beareth fruite grow vine cut withereth knit faith wee beare fruite branch abiding vine sucketh sappe draweth iuyce fruitfull faithfull true beleeuers receiue strength graceephes crucifie owne lust resist corrupt bring forth fruite according god whole bodie gathereth increase fit manner soule quickeneth membersgal luk end christ wrought saluation gaue himselfe sinnes deliuer v present euill world haue receiued minde know god iohn luk psalm rom heart loue please strength also sensible measure obey saith know ye ye dead sinne made partaker vertue power christ naturall corruption hath lost vigour force bring forth bitter fruitesby change beleeuer sensibly discerneth present state former also ye aliue god haue strength liue holilie iesus christ grace although perfect yet weakest beleeuer apparant difference former estate whereby godly life irkesome v sweete pleasant weake troubled change smallthat troubleth weake matter change heart renewing thereof hardly seene meanely felt within cannot satisfie themselues wishing desiring changed although open grosse fault accuse yet inward corruption doe disquiet idle motion vaine thought fantasy much trouble praying reading hearing cannot ridde feare beleeue euen haue receiued beleeue staiednes minde peace want feeling comfort faith oftentimes vnkindnes god much greeueth besides vnfruitfulnesse short haue many accusation themseluesyet note state good duly considered doe testifie deed another estate mind though weakenes diuels malice feare hereby sometimes renued changed al maruailed much lately drowned sinne delight goodnes must need strange vnto perswaded better case seeing motion sinne doe trouble haue skill strength enough thinke good signe welfare grieued deede thinke signe miserie haue yet doe earnestly seeke better staied euen idle vaine wandrings labour see spirituall pouertie inward corruption selfe loue priuie pride distrust c may haue cleere testimonie though part truely reformed change heart foundation godly lifeand change heart haue neede perswaded desire liue christianly shall hard matter proue compare themselues said matter finde otherwise shall coldly goe seruice god whatsoeuer pure heart say comming faith vnfained must strong foundation laid vpon godly life builded may neede feare double heart god abhorreth seruice doth accept heart halues serued halues saul sam haue whole giuen vnto loued littlenote neither beseeming greatnes neither fit offer receiue great good thing hand none doe shall see sufficient cause hereof namely infinitely indebted bountifulnes towards shall make chiefest delight treasure doe world therefore account tediousnesse toile labour till haue obeyed voice saith prouer jf men first gaue god heart whole life better giue thine heart sonne men first imbracing gospell thus giue heart men long haltmany hardly brought giue whole heart therefore giue ouer driue brought hoping lesse may serue may please god without adoe accounting hard yet must brought done else shall see vaine doe common commoner thing breake denie whereas desire tend good leade god yet time taken vp wishing somewhat neighbour hurt whereby besides deceiuing owne heart spending pretious time dreames thing come passe plainely shew would haue wherein although containe themselues one time without consenting haue foolishly wished yet haue gouernement ouer heart offend sort another time deceiueable vnprofitable wearisome life say nothing perill commeth soules hereby thus become seruants lust created god singular end thus haue sort laid forth lust heart god men thoroughout commaundements swarming wicked menthese lust cause woe haue shewed ruling carrying cause dissolutenes licentiousnes disorder liues many sore punishment thereby haue said matter may appeare singular mercie god vnto child heart nursery draffe abhorre rather though grace renouncing filthines little regarded common sort counted precisenes yet shall ornament god precious comfort vnto themselues chap inward euils sinnes properly discouer bewraie loathsome kennell whence ill life doth come doe well knowe therefore suspect sort danger taste former briefelie set downe euill monstrous though men possessed deale neither god men yet many renounced come knowne god seruants resisted according wisdome god hath giuen although others rule raigne obtaining grace doe one part christian life haue said making word god guide haue benefit made wary circumspect euill noisome corruption dauid saith psalme setting downe many v benefit law word god desired fine golde sweete hony combe addeth moreouer thereby thy seruant made circumspect wary salomon saith like prou wisdome delighteth thy heart knowledge entreth thy soule shall counsell preserue thee vnderstanding shall keepe thee euill way way worse deuices desire euill heart saint paul likewise shew god hath giuen grace faithfull one saith cor weapon warfare carnall mightie god cast hold casting imagination euery high thing exalted knowledge god bringing captiuitie euery thought obedience christ ephesian haue learned christ aright haue taught cast concerning conuersation time past old man corrupt deceiueable lust thus therfore hauing laid open packe worldly lustsa speciall part godly life renounce proued lord scripture giueth greater grace obey iames rom proceede shew speciall peece christianitie thus hold vnder resist sort may made able ouercome man greatlie denie aduised hinder one vnburthened passion inordinate desire binde dutie cord may goe forward without let readilie roundly alwaies vnderstoode without dailie striuing obtaine closed infirmity stillhebr euill heart causeth men fall away liuing god iusts marre al fleshly lust fight soules hinder walking god1 pet iam bring destruction end euen lust iames saith fight member carrie v violently foolishly setled peace fret rage enemy warre one another wee haue desire satisfied obtaine wee would therefore weakened force restrained may cleerely see ease cheerefulnes christian life shall set vpon sauiour christ voide corruption sinfull desire therfore prince world attempting hee doth men yet found nothing sought fit purpose adam time innocencie stood free season falling yet heart tained euen heart clensed purged natural corruption although wholy ridde troublesome lust passion appalled weakened within v hauing receiued deadly wound cannot master v shall loue desire long god though respect ought weakely vnperfectly yet respect otherwise wee doe soundly good sort shall accepted psal ioh god accept holie seruice looke streightly done amisse pardon sinnes aduocate notwithstanding obedience farre yet may rest therein euen sound peace voide feare thus farre god great mercie hath made v partaker knowledge wee hauing desire wise subiect haue said wee may possesse soules peace heauenly manner therefore manhe obserues occupied godly life iam whose heart purified faith doth exercise himselfe knowing soule shamefull lust marke led away deceiued doe trouble oftest preuaile therefore helpes god hath giuen shall set downe next treatise doth resist let doubt occupied godlie life come stinking sodome old sinfull course thus doth godly man carrie himselfe marke doth hee chiefly aime true wisedome aboue euery godly man hath name called wise wisedome sheweth selfe manner holy conuersation meekenes suffereth contrary lust dwell abide heart bitter enuying prouokings one another swelling tumult stormings one another like euery one hath measure deede men haue ouercome themselues alikeall ouercome alike euen haue set themselues worke plucking downe ruines old building haue great cleere knowledge god whole mysterie godlines ioyned affection forwardthe better sort speake plainlier make faith godlie life treasure indeed finding feeling greater rich pleasure behinde iudas traitor oh happie zaccheus haddest learned short timeluk many thy companion sinne greedie thou wert vnmercifull poore violent drawing others inriching themselues neuer learne life time full truly doe verifie scripture saith easie camell goe thorough needle eye rich man enter kingdome god well could learne thee cast vp gorge set lesse aboue thing yea aboue god himselfe though owne perpetuall shame woe haue made delight must proceede ende therefore laying forth example forcible woman gospell luke hauing zaccheus woman notorious life yet saw many great sinnes forgiuen vnchaste life detestation token thereof made eye allured men vncleanenesse basen water wash christ feete haire head abused purpose token vtter renouncing vngodlines towell wipe feete yet detestation said haue shewed toward sinnes greatly troubled stucke neere many could allow sinnes nature loued custome long lien need doubt lesse inticing much renounced may truly concluded beleeuer christ forsaketh olde sinnes though neuer pleasant vnto chap foure sort hope saluation yet renounce open sinnes outward offence bvt need spend many word matter seruants god haue ought cast outward sinnesthe vngodly scorne professor liues faulty another thing chiefely regarded thinke good aduertise christian reader many seeme godly may take heede himselfe least found number referre foure speciall kindes first grosse offender euery vile person knoweth haue made greater shewes godlines common sort doe yet light good liuing indeed go deceiuers euery vile person say readie laugh scorne hath reason enough thinketh bring disgrace prophane person hath found hypocrisie hollownes heart open oft committed euils little reuerence yet shewed hath christian religion selfe meaner account cause deny shame walke sincerely indeed without iust cause rebuke yet little moued example neither greatly reuerenceth take good reprocheth rather hath seene many beside outward appearance zeale little gratious liues better himselfe therefore hardened thinke rest wilfull blindnes hardnes heart though fearefull signe god vengeance god hath giuen ouer owne heart desire yet meane great part may iustly attributed liues professing godlinesse deed denied nothing lesse went for2 tim whose cursed course liuing meane haue caused others fall dangerously doth witnes speake fore enemy soule nothing men goe seldome haue seene reclaimed euill custome course haue long lien brought change charity better hope might conceiued liued haue died little good could easily reaped thee knew might beware grosse liues appearance religion iustly ill spoken among prophane better neuer made profession one example saul seene though offered sacrifice true god yet thing odious eye wicked world sam worst seruants could brought approue ioyne saue one euen cursed doeg edomite forementioned sortthe second sort bad professor ignorant carelesse shall adioyne three kindes bad one shall easily appeare infinite person liuing among good christian giuen god thus hath heart humblie turned towards god againe loue delight doth see say man daily hauing remembrance vnspeakable kindnes god towards wofull estate otherwise loath displease gracious god follie wandrings needlesse phantasy causeth surfeited manner iniquitie know heart deceitfull corrupt vnholie speake onely wicked world reader may see faine often put minde euen god hath separated prophane sort serue although according know god haue care auoide offence yet doe many seeke set themselues know might god owne duty neither grow forward many good thing might doe beleeuing assuredly god supplie want helpe infirmity would rather doe many thing great offence otherslittle acquaintance heart brings great bondage al little acquainted heart many tuchie froward wilfull worldly daungerous manner god minde meanes whereof maintaine dangerous opinion law wise preached papist protestant disagreeing fundamentall point religion may yet agree together saued like many also waxe secure slouthfull common sort otherwise blemished daungerously common frailty part roused vp god sharpe chastisement taking away deare friend afflicting owne body sore sicknes diease feare death mind darknes ignorance feare god wrath heauines thought sometime neuer haue taken hold vse learned word much checked humbled remember boldnes pride fault somewhat quickened liuely hope god againe bee intreated also heart bee brought stoope bow god meekly readily stifly stand owne conceit manner god forced call backe many better without sharpe correction haue made meate drinke please thing thus heart inlarged inlightened see themselues readilie withstand sundrie temptation hardly resist gainsay found continuall irkesomnes toyle goe worse hardning heart would see sore blemish vnto like say outstrayings till god chastisement call backe againe fruites ill ordered heart euen said ill gouerning heart causeth excrement come disguising person breaketh offensiuely therefore need bee looked vnto holie religious care point hand although bee exceeding fauour godan high grace liue well without whip correct fault child purge amend fatherly affliction rather remaine vtter ruine person yet much better neuer haue giuen occasion thereof carefull keepe themselues within compasse brother doe though best others exempt common frailty god elect yet doe labour espie hinder hold corruption vnder secret sifting suing vnto god groanes request breake foorth openly iust offence others least rarely may bee seene keepe heart obseruation diligence doe yet hath said denie dearest child god may possiblie nay easilie haue seene sometime holden vnder bondage sathans subtiltie othersthe faithfull part thus kept downe time shall drowned loue earthly thing caried away sinfull obtaine delight heauenly spirituall armour christian well exercised may doe thus farre preuaile recouer themselues againe get superioritie ouer heart finde feele god chiefe delight ioy doe see bee otherwise haue truly tasted good lord shall cut number earthly noysome pleasure wont solace themselues amisse considered aduisedly gather doe make light matter sinne while thus speake though thought might shaken burre hanging garment holie ghost saithsinne shaken burre heb cleaueth fast v euer v know sinne raging diuell strong lion suggestion assault hardly gainsaid shewing himselfe angell light wee seelie discerne weake resist yet must say mightie lion tribe iuda stronger christ giueth wisedome finde subtilties2 cor greater spirit god v wee confidently beleeue trust thereto sin deceiueth inticeth v haue grace ye say therefore vsgrace vanquish sinne may obtained day day haue say againe many speake haue taught haue promise ouercome faith therefore may doe still better better euery day experience wee haue although graunt thing hard throughly seasoned knowledge doctrine instructed oft made familiarly acquainted wil louing kindnes god whose case much pitied growing cannot great yet certaine thing often taught vnderstood shall goe farre better others shall ease get victorie ouer speciall corruption slouth distrust like acquainted seasoned shall haue experience god power helping ouercome seruants vnto might otherwise haue maistered example hereof haue many dauid doth declare constrained cry itpsal saying thee lord offended great euill shoull haue said sinne neuer broke openly sight men let loose heart first sight god gouernment therefore euery god seruants according measure knowledge may haue ouer heart wish might kept continued doubtles although ouercome temptation yet weaken much diminish strength cursed fruites easily often breake fourth annoy themluk good treasurie heart carefully kept would bring foorth better thing ye aske meaning onely exercise religion prayer reading hearing haue helpe furtherance thereby worship god feruently commodity small common action affaire busines reape benefit thereof though common thing found world yet men continuall care ouer heart keepe well ordered shew talke dealing market buying selling family among neighbour well among stranger thing may lawfully occupied say men behaue themselues plainely simplygal iustly peaceably patiently meekely kindly gently faithfully temperatly humbly state degree euer yet without disgrace nay greatest honour credit yea mercifully also occasion offered thinke found christian else looked would lesse ioy heart behold adorne beautifie thema peece heauen liue keepe heart well psal paterns say otherwise little heauen deale liue among euen see peece hell dwell contrarie disposition iacob must haue constrained abide esau god people captiuitie edomits god singular loue confesse restraineth many excesse euill would otherwise doe seeing otherwise none could able liue whereas thus bridled good lawes shame vaine glory doe depart much iniquitie thus patch vp kinde life among men yet know without religion feare breaking christian bound onely found heart well gouerned shall neuer please godvvithout nothing sauory haue fauour approbation euen common men may complaine cry till haue worne tongue stump without redresse fowle staines shamefull blot contrary forementioned vertues still vsuall haue almost euery many ministery people bee though godlinesse tied church walles pulpit illustration proofe benefit well guiding heart haue said thus may see heart well orderedfruite well ordered heart neither suffer affection stray farre willingly harbour euill lust though may creepe stealth yet examination shall finde many shall readie found purge expell also shall nestled v able poison liues oh gaine vnualuable say lesse benefit well ordered heart may conquer many daungerous sinnes others want doe vsually commit shame much sorrow accompanying see fruite well seasoning keeping heart frame account v yea hinder thinke needefull done labouring see great treasure fearefull bondage want come vpon v alasgood moode looking heart fittes good moode taketh v common daungerous desire desire haue spoken neither therefore able helpe thee thou wouldest fruite faith1 iohn ouercommeth let world thing euen faith meane while perswaded christ iesus loueth v readie doe thing finde feele many god deare seruants finde thus oft time neither able saymany weak discouraged want victorie feele contrarily doe complaine life full disquietnes cannot ouercome force anger impatience feele said god bountifull liberalitie hath prouided may feele findmany know libertie estate may bettered spirituall libertie enlarged besides many good people doe know long time god hath bequeathed nay many neuer know one many sweet liberty priuiledges god child receiue much light father light therefore rightly called child light whereby see way kingdomeephes according knowledge haue thereafter draffe worldly lust would might lodged much annoy thereby much readily disposed vnto dutie imbrace contented vncertaine deceiueable perswasion god fauour refusing bee holden within narrow streights finde pay deare liberty constrained repent seeking themnote yet cannot easily recouer inward peace lost shake againe yet gladly would want two contrariewant daungerous slouth inconstant vnsetlednes doe settle themselues one good thing euen godly doe finde sweete fruite life bee found namely safetie vnder god protection time time improuidence wearines well doe little little plunge themselues deepe vnsetlednes hard arise againe therfore salomon two word hath fitlie expressed saying let feare lord thy heart continually prou much diligent care please constancie therein thus haue said former rule vertues guide v liue godlie two commanded diligence constancie oneephes readilie prepared wee ought practise good resist euill whereas slacknes care little condemned thereby wee may continually
