righteous iudge shall giue day onely loue appearing haue long former point occasion haue shewed throughout whole discourse godly life must continued end cease say thus hauing set downe vertues must guide v practise godlie life throughout whole course may easily bee seene euerie man come thus farre may prooue himselfe repentant person apt fit bring foorth fruit amendement particular action whole conuersation may bee may beseeme man god farre humane frailtie suffer wherein wee follow christ iesus himselfeother two vertues humilitie meeknes matth wee must know duty must practised humilitie meeknes saith submitting selues doctrine leading godly life learne humble meeke hee say ye bee hautie high minded ye despise simplicitie doctrine thinke base thing subiect froward vntractable point ye wil hold back though ye obedient ye neuer liue godlie god requireth therefore must haue place christian either minister priuate person contrarie vertues haue said oft time scripture set downe togetherephes col well place wee may know needfull alwaies goe together although bee many goodly gift man yet hath shall lose credit beautie amongst behold withhold commoditie wanteth alwaies necessarieand two particular vertues sometime may haue vse fruites spirit necessarily required action time humblenes minde meeknes spirit may wanting vertues confesse common well forsaking euill good vnderstand though put place set seeing former part treatise large haue said matter wish well obserued life beleeuer continuall proceeding departing euill endeuouring duty manner hath said setled course repentance constant walking god idle vncertaine stumbling vpon good action while great part life neglected looked must sometime commaund readie offer seruice god good moode take owne libertie doe listeth lord seruice like disordered seruice many vnreformed gentleman besides attending table horsebacke attender may runne like well gouerned familie appointed office place one thing another well occupied kept idlenes yet discharged thereby doe sauiour teacheth seruants seruant familie hath wrought fieldluk discharged duty doth busines home haue fruitfull haue purposed doe required haue done dutie end one worke beginning anotherdeut yet al without toile tediousnes hath god prouided seruants may merie worke yea whatsoeuer shall put hand vnto duty redeeming time idlenes vnprofitablenesmatth deut merrier much work lord familie many place serue slouthful idle one howsoeuer haue place sometime earthly gouernment yet expelled thence saint peter warneth v neither idle compared trade wherein men goe one worke another christian hath many sin weede labour therefore carelesly marre worke houre hath well followed sundrie day loseth hath cast dice hath also many duty say marrying lord may also liue lord together speake plainly haue married hope shall finde helpe thereby vnto godlines could haue inioyed alone without seeing mariage ordained god himselfe helpfull estate many way gene dwell together according knowledge pet performe easily duty one mutuall helpe comfort communion good grace person though god accounteth mariage bed vndefiled vse lawfull increase posteritie subduing concupiscence yet end god people may remoue much vnseemely prophanenes therein irreligious sort inuet themselues neuer vse looke liberty vnderstand lawful end may haue right vse thereof god hath taught sanctifie mariage bed prayer thanksgiuing nothing done betwixt themselues wound conscience breaking peace true vse made fit cheerefull thereby duty holines leastwise neuer vnfitter liue mariage euen maried liue happily whereas liue otherwise great abuse thereof papist malicious railing maried person liue ye flesh serue god pope siricius shame spoken yt god hath made knowne wil commandement cleerely rest giuen grace feare obey either minister priuate person pride hypocrisie blind intention haue vowed complained maried estate ignorance prophanenes world much calling family company wordly matter men doe highly offend god think may deale thinke good carefully endeuour directed rule word teacheth god hath set amongst others may learne shadowed werematth vnder wing good example paterne life god would haue v leade whole world well nigh stranger though little reioycing principally scornefully refuse instruction require doe willing practise indeed must granted respect set themselues vphold corrupt estate world hath euer lien haue therefore many commend good example haue rather ill spoken follow excesse riot others doe pet especially dwell diuell enuieth credit good report yet worst controuersies need driuen trust soonest choose comprimitters knowing men good vpright conscience rather others wee reade saul account dauid spake according sound reason made sweare would kind friendly posteritie sam honour haue lord people therefore turne little obiectors let thinke age affoordeth none fit example themwhat vse light must made prou psal let rather wise discerne least pleasing god hard see willing vnderstand easie found desire let reuerence loue excell pietie vertue pretious thing let aime also may bee like lie still darknes accustomed god hath blessed better liking knowledge let loue frequent companie desire neither idle vnprofitable seeing hath set amongst farre great singular purpose carnall eye see discerne let labour see owne want cause make much may helpe supplie may learne come grace without helpe neuer haue attained vnto carrie themselues humilitie reuerent account making better greater measure god gift shalbe longer led former doubt whether christian life shall praise god highly setting light example eye may directed farre inlightened shall soone alter language speake new tongue act chap compared prophanenes railed apostle said drunken new wine fore part day conuerted peter sermon learned come humilitie reuerend title men brother asking counsell abused rather doe saued answere second obiection chap last obiection godly life answered yet another obiection answere might great weakning holie courage seruants god well fenced isthe third obiection godly life seeing teach publikely haue set downe estate godly professe without feare thus people god must walke wee affirme god pleased darke dead life led men good intent without certaine rule guide much lesse contrarie godlines diuers take great offence hereat arise vp v manner saying ye goe farre bragge againe remember many haue fallen like haue stood dauid peter others therefore good say men professe others doe may bee great wondring great trespasse shall committed kind men better setling quieting god weake child answere answereby grace god bragging farre v wee also heartily desire may be1 pet neither doe goe farre word warrant wee afraid vtter wee know nay wee dare doe otherwise though selues much others wee shall set light time neither feare shamefull falles shall thing sooner take hold v speaking truth boldly remoued farre vsprou while nothing afraid offend thereby either pride boldnes breake farre cause lord chastise vsbitter fruit declining wee careles improuident ouer selues sathan againe bewitch v deceitfulnes sin looke none othermich beare burthen vnquiet minde reproch due v thereby punishment shall befall v offencevve shall recouer though ouertaken yet shall rise againe though many v fall stedfastnes yet true namely god haue holie christian life haue set downe practised others howsoeuer wee turned way season whatsoeuer might become v yet able stone raise vp child feare prouide true worshipper whatsoeuer become v truth god remaineth worshipper him2 tim fall dauid must depart iniquitie dauid great wisedome goodnes god fall glasse behold god mercie imbolden sinne thereby like trespasser possibly might despaire1 tim cast away hope forgiuenes sinne selfe arose nourishing giuing place secretly heart vnlawfull desire eye occasioned treatise labour call men appeareth owne confession psalme hee saith thee lord psal thee haue done euill haue said though offence horrible men yet hence came seeing feared god secretly while yet offence came foorth openly say may learne beware inward temptation outward occasion sinne boldly professe doe thus hauing answered doubt dauid wise bodie need take hurt yet know doe draw example libertie sinning euen one example much turning themselues take good adde one thing would otherwise haue omitted seeing haue made mention dauid right sight lord king turned away nothing commaunded day life saue matter vriah hittite therefore vsuall thing neither oft thus offend case well knowne vnto cause wee discouraged sound course feare least fall like manner watch thing wee may feare peter say somewhat christ ascensionpeters fall howsoeuer hee faithfull many part life commendable yet great strength growth grace wee ought content rather looke bee light good example good workes least fall away daungerously one denie master knowe god correct dearest seruants fearefull manner blessed name wee know thus much minde taketh pleasure trouble neither delighteth suffering much lesse doth take aduantage infirmitieslam draweth deepe danger haue plunged themselues prouoke notif prouoke god feare soule lust feare reprochfull euils sent vpon v therefore count pleasure please bee watchfull occasion sinne giueth v holy boldnes confidence shall kept fearefull falles note pet rather afraid godly neither peter thus armed offended may easily see therefore fell naked vnarmed others case dishonour god fall may also fall while yet without confidence god thought best action doe many would haue v namely shew professe others make comon professor example rule liues liues dunghill fraught vnsauourie filthines offending god lightly neither let men sayobiect liue otherwise haue done discontentedly say wee would haue take delight thing husband wife must sit looke heauily one vpon another neither may neighbour merrie together may vnderstand first point obiection say themselues lord supper necessarie haue fallen haue said herein standeth preparation receiue lord supper preparation one three thing necessarily required shall profit come vnto lord supper preparation offence therefore shall neede offer violence himselfe hath kept christian course life followed good direction peace conscience doubt many doe yet oft shall repaire sacrament estate shall much confirmed strongly setled duty christianitie shall examination finde see though fraile meete guest lord table therefore welcome thrust companie want wedding garment shall great comfort many time oft say merry making lord boord either hollownes behalfe biddeth many men inuite table onely temporarie earthly benefit behalfe receiuer much accounted farre otherwise namely goodnes perpetuitie benefit hath companion euen continuall feast hath therefore great force stirre vp partie honour god hence communicant one admiring goodnes kindnes god declared himselfe felt inioyed breaketh forth praise assist v hath promised ordinance god author doth promise blessing therto oft partaker come reuerence feeling want earnest desire confidence obtaine thing pray true repentance shall receiue fruite accordingly herein preiudicate opinion rash iudgement doth much harmevvhat holdeth publike prayer reason minister haue part disordered person ignorant many remaine still thereby haue brought themselues god iust iudgement owne desert sonnes ely dishonour discredit hath come passe rash preposterous iudgement many haue euill opinion hath done seruing god haue vsed therefore haue thought haue good cause sequester themselues present seruice god performed thus obiect another sort haue thought set formes prayer dislikedhow others withholden onely allowed offered vp god extemporarie gift conceiued vttered according euery one necessitie opinion also reformed say somewhat obiections though otherwise bee besides purpose discourse large say haue taken hand publike prayer hath said preaching sacrament great helpe godlines haue measure true godlines else long themselues ignorance darknes doe know ought pray alwaies manner supplication giuing thankes therefore publikely well priuately many heart powred god rather one alone know sinne greater resist spurne fortifie say first obiection answereanswere first obiection although bee denied example ignorant vnreformed especially notorious person ministerie hath done doth much harme yet either cannot conuicted crime cannot remoue place iust cause griefe haue thing doe god matter weightie dealt al high reuerence yet burden must borne aske among many sweete liberty inioy wee may ioyne prayer wee pray faith seeing vnworthines cannot withhold fruite god promise v one kind prayer well another aske ye shall receiue ioy may full ioh farre patrone iustifie yet wee may inioy ministerie better would refuse bee partaker prayer offered vp blame desireth pray better yet better ioyne sometime leaue assembly publike altogether concerning next obiectionanswere second though minister offensiue former yet vse set forme prayer moued god spirit answere fond error thinke necessarie thing prayed men alwaies thing pray lord may prescript formes prayer made concerning thing letteth reading formes either confession sinnes request thanksgiuing letteth say hearer heart may profitably goe humble quicken comfort reading selfe vnpure minister owne behalfe people vttereth god speake ye see matter prayer reading matter erroneous naught pronouncing maketh good reading doth good pure vttered pronounced reading cannot hurt make euil church scripture doth sing psalmes vpon booke god yet though vtter prescript forme word hope none say sinne doe heart prepared like manner follow prescript forme word praying sinne therefore ought offensiue said men repeate forme word daily doe reading publike prayer must needes coldly done abhominable god answere oft praying thing maketh odious god done vnreuerent vnprepared corrupt heart custome feruently faith satisfie may know church best reformed would alleage prescript forme prayer vsed therefore minde ought must separate themselues church also set forme prayer vnlawfull neither lord prayer set forme prayer prescribed sauiour himselfe vsed yet though bee sometime vsed forme wherein set downe yet speaking occasion thinke amisse adde one thing though sauiour tied v matter prayer perfect full yet tied v word themselues seeing wee cannot either thinke remember desire one instant particular contained besides crauing particularly thing stand neede stirred vp moued thus answered proceede perswading good christian lay aside contention endles many also needle question matter resolue themselues seeing must al well aduised bee graunted publike prayer helpe stirre vp god grace v conuey v many good blessing god wee want beside notable effect therefore looke themselues euery way carefully may euer keepe themselues fit helped benefited well ordered heart mind attend vnto applie themselues prayer either sermon vttered whole action god worship read hearing led opinion take profit common sort doe long going church doe prooue truly haue taken good indeede able shew praythe booke common prayer letanie exhortation baptisme behaue themselues action seeing haue libertie heare god word preached may commodiously inioy willed onely themselues call vpon child heare sermon minister vrged well preaching liuing giue good example therefore take part cheerefulnes thanksgiuing singing psalmes reade attend neerest congregation may ioyne consent action praising god rest assemblie gaze tosse vaine imagination phantasy lift vp pure heart hand god refuse come take part worship god altogether brownists like let beare shame men peace shall small godward sit home owne bare reading diet scorne best liberty word preached prayer sacrament publike assembly vnderstand doe well otherwaies confession themselues magistrate examining whole moneth quarter absented themselues publike meeting answere made examinate sate home read themselues let iudge spirit led guided hauing described shewed nature vse publike meanesnecessitie priuate helpes thinke needfull doe particularly enter discourse priuate say somewhat necessitie well publike thousand professorsthe priuate helpes little acquaintance men also godly visible church amongst wee must hope god hath many elect little acquainted priuate doe thinke needle hearken besides deare child god want ordinarie teaching haue little vse therefore much worse cause therefore like knowne holden firme perswasion priuate sort needfull publike may vsed time whereas publike cannot persecution necessitie body soules haue daily refreshing therefore seeing publike cannot daily bee must vse priuate said therefore authorised commaunded one god publike part helpes god hath prouided profiting church therfore without priuate doe lesse profit men comming church besides great number know seruing god cannot doe good best christiansthe publike without priuate cold looked bee accompanied may bee seene euery part publike worship god hearing word read preached doth little profit ioyned preparation heare reuerently attentiuely mused yea occasion shall offer conferred also reading priuately may inioyed vsed manifest almost al congregation doe forget haue heard make little vse liues greater cause rendred hereof neuer looke matter concerning soules priuate dealing say church euen vse doe make lord supper part besides cannot tell prepare themselues minister carefull ouer people soules others doe teach examine knowledge haue yet cannot brought trie themselues indeede true faith vnfained repentance come seeing wont whole quarter receiuing beate braines trouble themselues matter whereby may gathered certaintie whatsoeuer scripture speake commendation therof little account reckoning doe priuately receiuing sacrament nourish good grace god themselues carefully speake euen better sort christian well others seeth shall haue much adoe bring heart willingly sift themselues seeke gift time say publike hearing prayer assemblie onely bee doubted pray hypocrisie drawing neere god mouthes heart farre doe neglect pray alone secretly god familie also publike prayer groweth common wearisome bare ceremonie fashion farre eased comforted prooue sure experience day haue learned make conscience priuate prayer doe separate one excuse neglecting priuate helpsand haue said may appeare necessarie priuate helpes vsed al haue part publike besides necessity doe require lord commanding hath giuen time libertie busines duty either familie otherwise vse holily continue worldly affaire ought giue place ignorance many count ridiculous foolish others though speake grossely yet giuen ouer world griplie put aside little busines seruing god although manifest god purely best serued busines earthly haue best successe line thought good discoursing priuate helpes set downe vse conscionably may thinke doe ought haue neede vse slackly coldly may bestowe greater diligence therein amongst sort may bee better regarde desire see good dayes vpon earth chap first priuate helpe watchfulnes begin according diuision made entrance treatise first priuate help watchfulnes worthily set first place seeing eye rest see well rightly vsed carefull obseruing heart diligent looking way may bee pleasing acceptable vnto godvvhat first obseruing heart salomon prooueth saying aboue obseruations obserue thine heart thence commeth life prou maketh man looke diligently way watchfull indeede let word prophet testifie thought take heede wayes psal sinne toung keepe mouth bridle god pleased appeareth contrarie said hebr withdraweth himselfe liuing faith cannot without watching soule saith god shall haue pleasure euen delighteth contrarie sundrie place scripture commended vnto v haue great care liue watch ouer way saint peter saith pet sober watch though say notwithstanding haue sobrietieit must goe sobrietie well ordering affection fit vertue keepe life frame yet without watchfulnes lost depart vsmatth mark c sauiour ioyneth prayer hee saith watch pray least ye fall temptation giuing v learne thereby force one much weakned abated without men shall make cold prayer watch liues yea oportunitie pray also render reason watching ouer selues carefully companion v seeing without plunged many noysome temptation sathan owne sinful heart besidesthe necessitie necessitie one helpe may easily seene owne experience contrarie sinne carelesnes securitie doth easily grieue holy spirit god quench v whatsoeuer chaseth away godlines doth set open dore confusion vrgent necessitie tim manner watchfullnes vse saint paul warnes timothie watch thing one therefore time place person occasion caused holy man god king dauid couenant professe seeing saw could discharge dutie god without especiall regard taking heede life reason sathans vigilanciepsal watch doe wisely saith till thou come vnto walke vprightnes heart middest house may thought speake absurdly speake otherwise men practise doth approoue view scripture thou shalt see truth cleerely must make foundation strong seeing great weight set vpon third hebrewesheb take heede time euill heart saith time meane lesse time time heart manifold affection desire thereof looked vnto taken heede least thereby lord offended c taking heede therefore thy selfe thy heart especially thence word action doe come must thy companion time time thou must set watch doore thy lip thou must well acquainted looking diligently thy way may goe well thee thou maiest prosper thou beest stranger vnto vnto thee looke fall often meane fall daungerouslyhe watcheth best sleepeth sometimes otherwise watcheth warily cannot free offending looke finde many woundes thy soule want many comfort thy life may boldly say cause many euil men doe make many iarres liues breake often vnseemely action doe many thing holy profession couer gentle name infirmity indeede doe rather wilfully fulfill desire heart rashly intemperately giue themselues bridle refusing vtterly case holy watchfulnes yea sticke count bondage depriuing christian libertie streight holding whereas seeth watching life eyelid eye eye selfe whole body doth easily fall many annoyance except carefully wisely guided wind weather fareth thy soule life thou doest take heede god word good instruction teacheth thee due looking thy way safety thy life much euill want watchingand seldome welcome men little vse therefore wel ordered setled course diligently kept meere stranger contrariwise secure part therefore haue least heart frame liues voyde good order thing bee said goe religious shall hot hastie furious fit liued with1 sam king nabal others vntrustie hollow cannot dealt gehazi ala weary often reprehending complaining vnreformed quality action part goe christian many may thought indeede yet vntill take knowledge want watchfulnes learne bee acquainted shall neuer better stay neuer setled christian must frame himselfe itbut must goe purpose set minde delight vpon desire better must content behalfe dealt child suffer handle much lesse play kniues people distracted kept water feare hurting themselues must christian abstaine apostle saith meanes weane themselues heart would naturally desire pet vvhat must weane himselfe watchfull psal euen euill lust fight soules destroy may bold venture companie without respect fall talke liketh giue themselues libertie desire prophet saith behaued himselfe one weaned mother breast experienced christian cannot remember lay open danger offence occasion became watchfull since doe see benefit keepeth safetie euery side may easily know bee able discerne ill goeth walke accompanied little little must gotten especially one help yea greatest vse obserue many good christian hauing well weighed doe thinke much diligently stand vpon watch thinking depriueth much sweete libertie therefore doe thinke good reason dislike refuse guided doctrine much done rashnes haste without good aduice whole life little better brought question yet since hauing found fruite sweet gaine great better aduice would wise forgoe againe let loose former rashnes resolued ought vse time time say one time well another yet haue much neglected obiect cannot mortified arethe answere say cannot watch bee alwaies obseruing themselues doe contenting themselues haue say speech much vnbeseeming christian professe growing forward watchfulnes kind grace yet count case better thinke serue god hope without adoe indeede beare themselues hand while generall sort pray time goe church neede greatly examine behauiour beside take heed vnto let please themselues list sure resist god greatly lamented men professor gospell haue little vse gracious helpe often preached vnto let goe see thou whosoeuer thou art desirest walke god peace thou circumspectly looke vnto thy step seuerall affection thy heart thou carriest thy selfe haue shewed thou oughtest endeuour thy selfe watch thing rather marked learned lendeth helpe rule hereafter follow directing thee al action day haue said followeth neither company othersvve must watch particular part life alone thy selfe canst thou please god prosperitie aduersitie except thou beest warie watchfull led god word therein necessarie christian vertue apostle paul ephesian giueth warningephes ye haue put whole armour withstood enemie yet take heede ye stand fast least subtile continuall attendance enemie fall greater may easily wee consider amongst many occasion prouocations walke shiftlesse auoide yea rather readie selues like well giue place vnto vvhy ought watchour euill lust wherewith full fraught doe carrie v headlong sundrie iniquity much wee goe nothing wee may feele discerne one way hurt v hand molest disquiet v cannot espie present time yet may perceiued afterward occupied holy spiritual duty haue shame hypocrisie one side hinder v dulnes wearines vntowardnes many like poysoned corruption side breake v haue doe thing lawfull indifferent owne nature euill recreation earthly busines secure careles doe haue boldnes defend selues manner end purpose neuer vaine euill go euill thing haue reason strength perswasion pleasure profit goe see danger accompanieth extenuate iteccles looke end ought doe sound reason disswade v weake diuel shewing himselfe time tempter yet afterward come v accuser repent therefore wee skilfull know disordred lust diligent espie preuent auoide haue foresaid watchfulnes ouer liues helpfull companion v cannot otherwise bee wee commit many thing vnbeseeming v contrarie holie doctrine wee professe follow many thing whole course liues man thus carried intemperate affection bringeth foorth loathsome fruite thereof comfort life affoord euen sad matter abridge themselues foolish vaine desire death withdraw heart fro long pluck back eye delighteth must feede vpon froth take comfort follie sound constant ioy haue made watchfull life greatest quiet haue therefore libertie free accesse solace soules varietie heauenly pleasure ioy say stranger vnto neither partaker thereof hereby lord hath freely graunted v finde inioy another manner liuing worldvvhen one watchfull one crosse maketh many blessing vnsauourie doe know beleeue euen peaceable life godward safe sweete meane farre sinner vale miserie may inioyed whosoeuer voide although haue varietie earthly pleasure delight yet one vexation comming among shall make comfort vnsauourie irksome vnto themexamples exod may appeare pharaoh one plague egypt vpon nabuchadnezzar dan hee fearefull dreame balthazar middest iolitie fearefull vnwelcome handwriting wall midnight seene himdan among none doth liuely appeare haman wealth honour promotion could satisfie himselfe one meane man yea straunger mordecai refused bow come neerer true god heard knowne may said saul although hee king yet lord answered heauines deadly1 sam nabal likewise heard must die goe became senselesse sorrow anguish stone zidkijah sam boasting spirit god yet false prophet flatterer driuen hide himselfe chamber chamber king arrow lord sent foorth king shelter could keepe michaiah told one disturbance life may truely say rest haue harboured purpose complaint people israel repentance turning god wherein declare one sinne trouble thus say confession haue sinned thee lord sam especially asking v king besides sinnes troubled asked pardon god appeareth storie sinnes drawne offend god would needes haue king god1 sam samuel sent god tell manner one would needes haue one contrarie god mind expresly said people would heare voyce samuel answered nay shall king ouer v like nation therefore sin whereby offend god put greatest trouble must especiall sinnes haue preuailed god child watched auoyded great reason forasmuch haue disquieted bend force strength euen one troublesome person towne disquiet whole would lay helpe together remoue keepe outan illustrating similies house hath many great commodity yet one sore annoyance principal chimney casting smoke great speede shall redressed thing yet regarded likewise life sound christian wherein many good blessing god may bee reaped inioyed god without rather imbrace immediatly vntill may see necessitie benefit possibilitie first two necessarie profitable haue shewed also appeare followeth lettes doe hinder remedy shew possible yea time easie become benefit fruite thereof chiefly appeare concerning letter many great soeuer speake haue doubt notwithstanding god assistance make way easie plaine true christian meditation treatise difficulty discouragement doe trouble shall remoued least weakned howsoeuer take profit shall haue way shewed leaues also may learne weekes make good benefit otherwise may without helpe voyde many yeares say somewhat therefore impediment firstthe let meditation diuers hold god people stranger vse meditation profit two sort either hinder altogether going entring else keepe taking good thereby although set apart thing purpose may giue themselues time wholy thereto former sort threethe first let remedie thereof first christian knowing dutie required goeth either morning perswade may conuenient time hath matter readines meditate vpon emptie barren vtterly seeke bestowe timevvant matter cogitation although hath heard many thing sermon wanteth many grace might driue rather meditation better come carrieth many corruption hath receiued many blessing mercy god yet diuell holdeth blinde forgetfull minde confounded occupied taken vp vsually way amisse finde nothing muse consider vpon whereby might season heart seeth thereby cannot proceede dutie hath taught performe desireth also doe exceedingly discouraged made heauie hearted thereby hardly perswaded goe vnable aske way redresse snared ouermatched diuell hardly seeke remedy thing amisse leaue altogether good perceiue themselues stopped cleane contrarie practise child world wise kind disappointed broken offluk purpose one way seeke accomplishment desire many way rather frustrated let haue set downe hereafter treatise way remedy vnto referre reader say certaine rule helpe meditate example also set worke yet least euery weake christian able sufficiently direct himselfe adde particularly shall expedient principally propound himselfe able foure thing till shall better able helpe himselfe muse first vnworthines vilenes seuerall corruption sinnes secondly greatnes god bountie forgiuing many subduing daily dominion sinne sathan thirdly thinke may guided present day rule daily direction especially seeme hardest followed well ordering heart framing life farre agree god word fourthly let meditate seuerall part christian armour god hath appointed strengthen thereby help set downe vsed daily better going forward sweete life shall help many respect otherwise possibly watch let may arise hinder course many may conueniently goeth hath thing necessarie best manner directed counsell able say especiall remedie helpe want matter meditate neglect omit varietie meditation shall set downe shall helpe forward also true beleeuer weake soeuer fit willing follow direction second let remethereofthe next impediment first sort hindereth christian meditating vnfit minde vnto spiritual heauenly duty carried desire slow vnwilling occupied cogitation consideration holy matter therefore letteth passe meditation finding himselfe vtterly vnable enter knoweth performed may sometime grieued omitting minde impotent hauing lost former strength time constrained yeeld omitting redresse answere omitteth thus vntowardnes heart vnfitnes good duty one hath learned resolued serue god euery day hardly beare disordrednes minde therefore seeke speedily haue remedied hee hath yet obtained gouernment himselfe doth dutie god generally seldome vncertainly must needes hardly redressed manifest one hath giuen minde libertie wander world christian course remedie receiue one although alike easie yet seeing lord let bring mind consideration say themselues haue receiued minde please god teachable readie dutie haue opposed selfe mine owne diuels secret malitious counsell though sweet flesh debter vnto yeeld vntowardnes heart sinne god manifold comfortable priuiledges hee hath giuen might bee faithfull wearie peace doe haste mine owne sorrow lord therefore bring backe ranging heart mine deceitfull dreames feares doubt hath snared restore libertie wont inioy solace selfe thy fauour communion thee count greatest happines commune thee may gift decaied mine owne fault sathans crueltie subtiltie restore againe vnto forgiue weake loue towards thee haue prouoked thy maiestie thou wouldest bee prouoked frowne looke amiablie thou lord chargest thus seeke thy face euen thy sweete presence haue gone time blinded hauing abilitie muse good thing haue seene seduced till perceiued lost sweete libertie therefore lord shew thy louing kindnes distresse weakenes restore libertie minde many thy child doe finde thus fall consideration thy selfe discourage thy selfe hast learned vse thy want humble thee bring thee neerer god rather goe conclude remedie one vnsetled heart cannot meditate part christianitie godlines hauing otherwise knowledge yea best remedie meditate present vnfitnes loosenes heart earthly mindednes count heauie burthen accuse heart bring relenting considering farre presently mildnes humblenes heauenlines readines vnto dutie haue time let man giue libertie sort euill heart turned away cheerefulnes willingnes part god seruice goe forward therein bring vtter bondage redresse second let third followeth want opportunitie leasurethe third let remedie thereof reason necessarie busines taking vp time vnto may bee added conuenient place wherein may goe apart company seaman must go farre dwelling vse hauing neither choise roome yet taken vp child stirring vp downe within compassed round house adioyning without small poore family seene alleage hindred necessarie busines denie may doe fall sometimes especially person occupied many thingsluk exhort weigh behooueth belongeth one thing necessarie ordinarie workes calling put dutie place doe vnskilfulnes vntowardnes commit fault one appointed god goe stand together vpholding inward peace say hindrance thereby workes ordinarie beseech mercifulnes god seeke cloakes slouth neither hold themselues backe profitable duty occasion great weight importance rather yeelding flesh call business occasios great weight omitting although household worldly affaire yet may trouble time omitting meditatio may performed another time business cannot commeth oft passe neglecting necessarie worke want discretion heede taking bee done although meane prayer reading meditation like gone troubleth mind say deepe griefe great discommoditie sustained long space quiet libertie serue god way againe seeing god requireth honoured v al thing euen earthly well spirituall therefore must think pleaseth whe man shall zeale without knowledge doe one time shall quench zeale want wise heed taking many time man hereby let loose ye bridle thing worldlines let know hath fro hence liberty returne necessarie let shall constrained let passe dutie meditation hereby let appeare haue necessarie without fault hee supplie dutie necessarie labour ended take heede wise omitted altogether vnlesse hee assured peace god omitting hath remembred way say hindrance commeth want conuenient place must done may conueniently seeing nothing gained neglecting dutie whereof standeth peace welfare thus much let hinder altogether meditating estate wee may fitter thereby vnto prayer good life let hinder v good profitable vse ittwo abuse meditation first vse sleightly make ceremonie breake three former may rightly called abuse two word set downe thus first commonnes customarines perswasion must continued doe houerly sleightly make ceremonie much looking heart well affected may bee iustly charged omitting itthe remedie must perswaded worthie delighted sinne easily soone committed priuate prayer also like good exercise mindes holden taking delight hereof seruing worshipping god onely fashion said god prophet vaine doe worship esai second although wee bee desirous vse itthe second clogged fraught phantasy care helpe edifying yet head full trifling wandring phantasy worldly matter wee cannot minde heauenly thing contrarie hence ariseth wearines hastning libertie heart may raunge list desire although corruption nature best god child doe complaine doe good would therefore good sometimes notwithstanding mislike bee resist yet watching ouer calling backe endlesse rouings may forget god bee held within holie compasse wheresoeuer become whatsoeuer goe must v time euill heart heb euen say cause cannot haue heart commandement carefully set selues corruption heart although god hath appointed especiall helpe well framing liues mind brought heauenly estate thereby would frequent yea although appoint especiall time thereunto yet shall turned musing good thing wandring shall hardly fasten good matter hauing yet certaine principall point concerning estate set v work therein many trifling phantasy dreames shall swimme braine age perished would vnderstand psal consider estate shall end deceiueable delight although cannot brought thinke end account hee speaketh plainly hath done time time although world shall haue new increase daily armed righteousnes godlines reach attaine vpholden hopepsa hath put v strengthened faith promise first imbracing receiued prepared staied affliction peaceable quiet heart gospell hath incouraged v shall able liue estate god shall set v place hee shall bring v chaunge occasion seeing hath strengthened v vntill see end difficulty vncertainties conceiue matter presently handled thinke aduice counsell needfull going thus armed thorough battaile life think themselues readie day till haue put lord iesus wisedome righteousnes sanctification redemption done faith count may farre christ helpe wherein want nothing helpe shall defended euils day behold know end mightie armour bequeathed v god haue wee acquited selues well brought worke day good end may doe one day another thus bring whole matter armour end also whosoeuer thou art canst perswaded resolutely thus armed thorough warfare thy life thee doubt leade safe way yea pleasant profitable beautifull honourable onely happie way thou thy selfe shalt say short time experience thou shalt bee able compare day thy life past euen best shalt finde euen first entrance weakest farre exceede greatest beautie longer thou shalt abide better thou shalt finde make thee loue thou shalt see continuall vse estate comparable neither maketh matter ignorant thou art perhaps may discourage thou hast knowledge enough see best wayes weake thou art thou beest strong enough perswaded walke gesse thou shalt want haue said god shall giue thee heart thus inclined bidding farwell course approoueth settle thee commendeth thee thou seest thou art acquainted armour helpeth thee daily liue innocently christianly consider thou hast rich maketh thee great priuiledges lord hath giuen thee1 sam abigaile said dauid thou shalt reape fruite thou shalt repent thou tookest counsaile glad highly thankfull thou haddest found great treasure weigh protection diuell thou hast thereby safeconduct falles feare doubt thou art deliuered mist ignorance scale thine eye pluckt thine heart strength thy strongest infirmity thou findest easily thou maist turne way againe time weakenes thou hast slipped yea consider moreouer peace thy conscience thou hast rest thy soule thou seest onely cleerely thou wert thus armed condemnation thee also god fighteth thee maketh thee fit resist deceitfulnes strong temptation wert faint impotent resisting word speake thinke meete concerning matter thou canst neuer sufficiently esteeme blessed estate although thou art vtterly free temporall affliction thereby oft time shalt thou thinking good continue till thou remembrest shadowe changing god oft time thou shalt wonder see liberall portion god hath giuen thee haue sweete communion haue confidence boldnes difficulty part world euer subiect dreadfull feare vengeance oft shall shew danger wherein lie thou shalt see feele much worth thus fensed daily vexation men turmoyled withall thou shalt neede doubt whether thou shalt willing keepe armour still thou shalt see thou canst feele thy selfe well without obiectionnow whereas may obiected man findeth libertie life arming man able set safetie manifold euils men complaine daily affirme knowledge reuerence giuing praise glory godanswere many peace conscience enioy little doubt many know yet perswaded thousand euen god deare seruants holden backe blessing malice common enemie kept stay subtilty either ignorant libertie thinking god doth honour seruants priuiledges liue therefore count presumption looke thing know yet doe fauour themselues present want infirmity doe vse small violence holden backe inioying comfort blessednes liues might otherwise partaker let know suffering heart take fill delight world little paine taken musing vpon heauenly estate slight praying principall cause seeing god hath promised worke meanes christian haue acquaintance armed life blessed fruites thereof many attaine hereto seeing neuer vnderstand although vtterly without faith god hath appoynted liue certaine direction throughout course armed thereunto generall manner onely serue god without great watchfulnes ouer particular action count burthensome must bee content bee brought shame sometimes doings sometimes terrour torment conscience slippery walking small regard honoring god aswell one duty another seeing property sinne cannot separated howsoeuer oft feare thing yet one time finde diet say must oftentimes looke kept settle themselues soundly christian life euen finde much shame sorrow god seruants shall voyde iudge estate hypocrite prophane sort none may bee troubled haue set downe power vse armour thinking haue saidobiection meere fancie vntruth seeing enemy wee fight strong raging many good seruants god haue subdued temptation whereas haue spoken much say conflict combat haue allurement sinne though resisted ouercame ease without great striuing satisfie answere speaking conflict belongeth another treatise namely fift handle doctrine let onely speake armour according part diuision set downeanswer yet none vnderstand marke thinke sinne lust bee easily ouercome call furious raging sathans suggestion obiects without soone resisted say slyly wrought deceiue v haue mightie crowned except striue lawfully stedfastly yea armour vnskilfull faint timorous vsing onely may also oft time foyled hope victorie preuailing past say yet weakest estate forsaken god though distresse time cor swallowed vp though sorrow despaire discomfort lowest ebbe temptation yeeld ouercome yet euen miserable others striue left selues see weakenes afterwards wee may gather strength fetch breath may take better hold resist valiantly especially owne default ouercome yet whensoeuer v deny came passe better armed either vnskilfull vnexpert slouthfull slacke vsing say still said whatsoeuer seeme doubtfull scarce like true want putting keeping christian armour estate vnglorious vncomfortable yet minde may christian good enough though know therefore satisfie canthe second obiection word thinke although fit meete strong christian yet weake one ought troubled seeking may content themselues serue god without reason least while lay strong loade burthen yet weake discourage driue heart altogether two obiections indeed wit man hearing present doctrine armour readie put forth past doubt troubled neither thinke nay know hath ouercome much hath well profited satisfying weaker answere euery duely daily regarded farre god giueth conceiue see indeuouring practise bring man increase daily sound libertie freedome bondage boisterous passion vnruly life recompence hundred fold sweet peace losse earthly vaine delight wont make flower garland seeing worke vpon simplest whose heart vpright lord hath opened conceiue therefore thou seest thou art one thou hast felt rule directio meane perswade draw thee follow theman exhortatio vse making common forgo libertie neither fall holy beginning neither quench thou flame grace cherish thee daily trust fleshly wisedome thine heart whereby thou mightest discouraged seeing thou hast often proued found deceitfull inquire still euery day lest poison lurke secretly corner waite thee mischiefe giue oportunitie thine enemie make thy hurt yet greater therefore cast vp vomite thou hast good vse like direction thou shalt feele waxe common vnsauourie thee vnlesse thou art sure thou chaungest better take courage vnto thy selfe cast diuell fasting prayer prouide thou mayest continue happie shalt thou hereafter thou thinke litle say tell thou shalt speede better way thinke vpon many yeares thou art continue discourage thy selfe thereby though thou tookest hand thing vnpossible toilesome beginning hardest young child led steppe another till go alone go thou first weekes moneths till thou hast gotten experience whole yeare time thy difficultie well ouer thou shalt find easie yoke light burden thee many degree thou wert wont exhort thee diligent regarding daily direction call thee either seeking knowledge practising necessarie dutie might required thy hand encourage thee thou shouldest store stuffe thy selfe meanes thou canst store treasurie thou maist fetch matter daily furnish thy life withall made fit vnto euery good worke day guide able carrie thee safely haue said howbeit shall please god bring light plainer sounder readie embrace rest thankefull god meane season helpe thou maist haue weake brethren sake goe chargeansvver therefore shall say lesse must cast away confidence beleeue god hath many wayes deliuer prouide hath bene lightly seene god hath bene wanting outward need therefore though triall vnto death yet trust lawfull meanes find helpethe poore vvho cannot follovv calling must relieued must say others neglecting duty suffer want might relieue god iustly bring lay charge meane good christian law land worthy al care conscience euer executed made ouerseers pooreby vvise care distributes ouerseers deut vvho haue needfull iam also hauing superfluity much necessarie food apparell yet rich good workes neither good poore amongst purpose iudgement shall without mercy shew mercie liuing member christ body church must pity bowel glad heart poore brother rare way need must though men left hand know right hand doth striue fall one another euen inioyned authoritie giue litle poore themselues may make mone fittest readiest relieue must beare burden easily haue hope christ exalted higher better speake godly considering god seruants haue seuerall cross make meete lord sory speake true need helpe others maintaining haue eares heare haue say lord ierem foolishier prophet saith know wayes lord iudgements god feare god say let go workepersvvasion poore contentment haue taught al true christian make vncomfortable toile waite promise shall fedpsal stay vp themselues example poore widow word saith man liueth bread againedeut king king psal lyon shall hungerbitten feare shall want againe lord hath many wayes deliuer know thereby sooner shall stone turned loaues bread shall forgotten starue hunger else prouide better leaue may omit one obiectionthe third obiection much amongst men whereas haue taught man neuer good labourer diligent husband walke painefully calling yet none commendeth god religious also men reply say negligent businesse seruants name say mind vpon workesome vvill haue seruants religious vvorke found oftentimes booke prayer sitting idly litle regarding maisters aduantage whereas occupie themselues religion held feare drawne hope reward maisters profit go worke lustily wherupon haue gone far haue vsually vttered speech whe soeuer make choice seruants neuer chuse religious latter speech answer addedansvver former part might charitably interpreted denied statesmany seruants professe hypocrite king many hypocrite among seruants make profession religion gehazai many reade denounce word lord shall beare punishment iniquitie grow absurditie thence religious seruants would chuse seruants least sinne made rash carnall speech much faultie much vttereth goeth better protestant declare businesse done beare rudenesse brutishnesse disorder seruants dishonoring god thereby behauiour must looked lesse religious commonly maisters iustly met seruants preferre religious againe whereas speech condemne professe well knowne manie seruants particular calling seruants well generall christian glorifie god highly shine light place shame accuser yet maisters might iudge seruants religious christian practise owne dutie looked hand haue loue liking gospell themselues vnblameable whole course others may see great want fault see seruants feared speake haue shewed giue alwayes best example let catechise also beside publicke teaching inioy alreadie willing liue christianly yet diligently louingly taught cannot soone brought great perfection done let proue whether religious prophane best seruants lastly men vocation adde haue vrged necessitie laboring extreame pouerty want stocke inforced giue ouer occupying hauing remedie hardnesse hart forgo nothing reliefe setting vp multitude poore folke thus say haue remedie able labour lawfull calling may peace conscience receiue almes please god therein keepe confidence grow forward knowledge watchfulnesse must alwayes accompany v euer foresee without shall nothing well therefore iourneying walking sitting still lying bed c shall remember held downe sinne infirmitie let v muse vpon occasion vpon vilenesseeither thinke sinne ouercome shame danger hard renounce god prouoked thereby therefore abased vnder confidence craue pardon grace weaken haue need cause take order earthly businesse otherwise turne v great troubleor thing indifferent dispose let v good aduice thinke selues dispose peace neither giue v occasion occupied let v watch good oportunitie alone make benefit time setting selues muse vpon holy thing loue god mortalityor muze heauenly ioy c inioy libertie talking god prayer thanksgiuing reading reioycing c haue necessarie duty done shall able calling let gone obiected hard matter thus must need say hard haue heart thus commandement selues especially cannot reade yet let v consider againe cannot better occupied say better nay hardly otherwise occupied without sinne aduice redeeming time alone long counsell lord thus gaine euill moued say neither vse solitarinesse thus though thought free giue heart libertie roaue raunge sure cannot prouident carefull way best follow rule sloughly inough reason vntowardnesse remaineth infinite occasion prouoke yet fruite answer labour shal bestowed shall vigilancy hold corrupt heart hunt scare away assault diuell euery side wisedome god hath giuen v shall able shall neuer suffer cary v foorth ill course way stead thereof procure great libertie freedome seruitude yea thus circumspect watchfull time solitarinesse wherein otherwise great daunger fall many wayes hath bene sayd shall come better furnished company behaue selues therein becommeth v yea watchfull say froth draffe heart expell hold idlenesse vanitie mind euill desire wandring lust c incredible aduantage bring v lesse dare boldly affirme hundreth fold spoken gospell one whosoeuer forsaketh ought christ sakemat cannot allow shall receiue euen hundreth time contentation peace comfort haue following desire therein c whatsoeuer strangenesse absurdity men shall thinke beobiection haue eye selues well ordered course broken time shall alone setting selues thing holy disposing thing lawfull watching carefully euill may owne choice desire list thinke good without strict tying v certaintie contentious trust shall easily answeredansvver say answer much like said thought hard let well weighed time wherein shall alone one three shall necessarie wherein thing besides almost shall tolerable allowable time solitarinesse wherein shall haue lawfull thing indifferent thinke family cross businesse preuent daungers imminent remoue ease trouble present way dispose matter peace good others wherein shall haue cause bewaile infirmitie oppresseth v cast ourselues heape dunghill corruption lodged within v complaine see know better wherein shall haue iust cause breake praise god like passing time holy matter hath bene sayd whereof great variety store speake haue vnderstanding iudge discreetly nothing say harsh vnsauorie hauing receiued god wise vnderstanding heart discerne promise strength therefore sufficient incouragement part life readily gladly rather desire earthly minded person range noisome vnlawfull liberty indeed deny cary flesh v burthen weigh v downe shall neuer discharge duty purely follow direction well taking vp time alone wished yet must learne indeuour follow rule giuen v daily better better suffer selues passe time securely without regard full purposing well bestowing directed although shall attaine fully would intended v faithfully euery one inabled god shall need repent v time passed may haue peace go shall aime labouring thus directed deare seruant god dauid didpsal prayed god word mouth might alwayes acceptable sight company soeuer come likewise meditation hart might please wheresoeuer become another psalme testifieth practise namely hide word within hartpsal perswasion greater feare v oft much thinking sorrow may increased cursed vndermining v hauing great encouragement lord ought thus stayed may auoide rest may go vnder contentedly waiting good issue hard thing christian walk vprightnesse heartspsal perfourming duty midst house lesse hard rare bearing discommodities trouble shew themselues light example rest familie vnquietnesses counted small admitted time liues seeing vnsettle draw v course therefore neither one kind affliction become vnsetlings v counsell must take lord haue set downeluc iam euery day arme selues feare may come impatience alreadie come vpon v let v thinke toyle watch looke selues thus may meanes rid toile indeed yea greater toile ease selues contrarie hundred fold shall onely prouide well herebyrom psal present experience proofe god helpe bringeth hope maketh ashamed experience shall find like trouble come strength got iosua thisexperience great helpe trouble oft time beleeued god promise found neuer failed trusting word spoken concerning victorie ouer enemy deliuerance insomuch proofe god keeping promise bringing ouer riuer iordane giuing iericho citie ay hand battell fiue king canaan triumpheth hope conquest lord hauing promised victorie ouer therefore saith souldiers men warre ouercame themios lord hath deliuered hand therefore good courage thing made apostle paule great affliction stay enemy haue said shall find rest soule daily otherwise found enioyed constantly neither beautie felicitie godly life sort possessed may though dreame perfection life yet walketh royall way shall doubt whether way shall time time shall accompanied throughout day day day faith hope loue humilitie meekenesse righteousnesse vprightnesse patience temperancie somewhat armed trouble hauing word according measure knowledge faith readie guide follow refuse therefore might seeme needlesse say matter indeed say setled firmely practise set downe shall find euery day lesse hinder christian life easie ignorant sathans enterprise whobut must know danger way first hardly cast much ado afterward fierce subtill hinder haue escaped hand therefore beare reader hand direction like easily obserued kept constantly read learned lest finding otherwise discouraged set backe haue said part alreadie much ado shall practised say much whole seeing chaining vp vnruly thought desire heart first seeme difficult although escape first plunge meane renounce cast practise altogether difficultie hardnesse seemeth conceiue hope god strengthen abide constantly therein great conquest yet must know fall many let hinder hold backe one time one way make doctrine direct without fruite vnto diuell haue said lay sundrie blockes way hinder going forward course liuing faith daily besides desire please god hart though acquainted direction guided come farre behind themthe weaker stronger christian must helped must therefore seeke proppe vp bring thus weake well giue rule strong indeuour bring litle litle estate well teach keepe good course haue attained finally must wise tender regard frailty forgetfulnesse earthly mindednessechristians must learne returne gone way coldnesse slouthfulnesse also ignorance want experience teach god hath taught v rise fallen come way occasio gone thus may much dismayed infirmity rather strongly encouraged haue better acquaintance life christian seeing many helpes meanes incitement thereto granted god also make better see themselues vilenesse remaineth sathans malice property many thing layeth way make stumble thereat reading may hold securitie faintnesse wearinesse christian course whereto inclined themselues though set forward thereto although oft man practiseth like daily direction certaine letted yet euery one seeth neither letted much lesse redresse therefore place treatise let needfull shew let lye way hold v following good direction practising christian life daily knowne may preuented auoided farre may haue peace shall rule directing v carefully obserued leastwise hindred manner way yet may see hauing remedy hand may glad repaire speedily vnto thereby returne way againe therefore haue thought expedient signifie chapter purpose speake whole treatise following like matter purpose helpe comfort cannot yet find lord yoke easie commaundements pleasant sweet vnto one time another one point another toilesome burthensome although haue first treatise said somewhat particularly sake could take fit occasion yet know many willing liue well christianly make toyle thereof find great pleasure duty therefore make question oftentimes seeing find hard whether best go forward especially haue bene driuen commit shamefull sinne therefore thinke expedient remoue daungerous thought shew way come vncomfortablenesse maine chiefe let diuell force subtiltie malice euill heart farre vnreformed mean thing world though owne nature made occasion v falling offending god whereby may gathered meane let hinderance treatisevvhat meant let euen whatsoeuer may hold v backe peace god euery able breake course godlinesse shall bend mind otherwise generall sort manner worship god liue men although preuaile breake course altogether yet one part godly life shall neglected one day another shall continue wise reioycing lord shall faile neither shall light shine amongst men whereby god might glorified darknesse bondage part god people holden although haue litle sight redemption dimme hope time sinnes forgiuen yet neither enioy part long time sweet libertie godlinesse haue estate lord hath graunted enioy haue shewed must therefore learne carefully resist let shall know stand vp way hinder therefore meane giue tast chiefe may see discerne shew helpe first generally set downe property diuell asfirst let generall malice subtiltie crueltie like sundrie sort worketh vpon heart poore christian deceiueth infinite wayes together set downe encouragement god hath giuen farre greater many thinke particular kind vvhat beand secondly particularly seuerall kind let hinderance sathan raiseth vp kind vseth heart world instrument ouerthrow particular remedy wherby incumbred let may count strange thing neither dismayed thereat shall reade may prouided helpe deliuerance chap sathans property attempt v generall helpe begin therefore first generally euen sathan meane withstandeth v euery good thing haue said leadeth v amisse many waies1 pet although see selues set free infernall woe therefore isiob heart cannot soone raunging though neuer litle readie meete set forward euillthe diuell meeteth v euery side slie subtiltie fasteneth liking affection aware maruell see suddaine vnsetlednesse v chaunge welordered course wherein hereby also meane deale nothing may possibly oft time snared knowing vse outward object hurtboth prosperity snare v cross vexe v home abroad wealth beautie friend libertie peace blessing contrarily loss sickenesse disgrace c home workes domesticall affaire abroad taketh occasion thence wheresoeuer whatsoeuer occupied scripture teacheth v v good soeuer v men world daungerous allvvhen least suspect doth craftily deceiue v least suspect particularly lay foorth cannot conueniently therefore men ignorant vnexperienced working property themselues maruailed though beare deadly wound vncessant malice subtiltie possible euery naturall man one way deepely bewitched made senslesse foolish pleasure profites dreames earthly happinesse come feare securitie hardheartednesse like estate world day euen thus vnbeleeuers deceiued holden band cannot either seeke desire know get expert haue heart exercised discerning good euill wrought hindereth god teach know mysterie secret sathans casting mistes eye rocke fast asleepe sinne haue proofe thing themselues shall farre easily see know helpe god hath left shunne deadly wound see poysoned baites auoide denyed manner sathan besetteth people though litle obserued seene vnbeleeuers vsluc whome openly resolutely set v therefore know enterprise property practises vigilancie malice time action company diuerse sleight dealeth according occasion offered weakenesse may easily discouraged therefore faint god forbidvve may faint though haue diuell v say doth onely kindle concupiscence within v owne lust set fire euill inclined also baiteth outward thing poison deale may dazle eye cast v hold may keepe still christian course yet ought dismayed know euen thesereason although cannot trouble v present time yet shall turne exceeding good making v set store god protection abide vnder gouernment continually seeing soone smart shake neuer litle therefore shall perceiue selues hindered distracted peaceable course continuance daily good course god would haue v know faint discouraged confidence full perswasion recouerie obtaining fauour confesse humbly wandring vnsetlednesse heart much hearkening sathans delusion whereby farre estranged god forsake may find mercy lord would haue none raunging vnder wing much lesse fallen infirmitie beguiled sathans subtiltie would haue thinke therefore shake hath made manifest well knowne gospellluc seeketh vp wandering lost must throughly perswaded vnto god child may neither great red dragon accuser brother subtile vigilant malicious strong yet part naked altogether vnarmed neither doth strength rest themselues deriue draw one mightier haue libertiecolos nay commaundement sonnes daughtersother reason strengthen sathan pet cor rom rom therefore like vnnaturally forsaken left themselues neede necessitie enemy reconciled death much reconciled shall saued life alreadie needesour greatest prouision sathan cannot much know heart sound kept without liking euill sometime meanest christian feeleth danger feared diuel himselfe much lesse world according salomon keepe thy heart diligence thereout commeth lifeprou haue experience find nothing true walke great libertie heart well ordered seeing heare saying heart holden subiection god time time desire thought though fond foolish captiuated therefore sathan taketh aduantage thereby make slaues bondman suggestion deceitfull inticements bereaue make voide sound iudgement thus come thing sometimes ashamed least haue iudged hardly others themrom thus commeth passe besides hinderance haue euill heart shall haue considered well pondered many wayes diuell letteth hindereth v shall see good cause prouide strongest helpe defence may clearely seene daunger feare may easily breake course godlinesseal sathans pursuings v tend either ouerthrow faith hinder godly life bad sleight practises particularly laid foorth apostle time knew know best haue felt found also would hardly beleeued scripture experience cleare witness behalfe terrifieth owne want ignorance infirmity vnworthinesses also feare shamefull falles seemeth vnlike auoide rather brings remembrance good seruants god haue fallen like manner besides vnsetlings doth worke while feareth care shall neuer hold faith holy course life vnto end persecution affliction shall stirred vp prouocations shall turned backe many oppresseth end may cast away hope confidence conclude resolutely haue faith though sleepie drowsie professor moued yet weake child together euery troubledhow shold helpe themselues let trouble faith till grow better acquainted nature propertie god promise namely true vnchaungeable perpetuall euen god himselfe also also except experience truth taught v yet newly imbrace glad tidings although would gladly enioy much yet weakely grounded estate want able ministerie set forward many poore christian case ala much say must ouercome present time indeed thus resisted flyeth saint iames saith hauing done best yet hath preuailed singular comfort may obserueiam experience may bring sure hope victorie againe like conflict said hath giuen ouerthe diuell leaueth troub e weake beleeuer though vanquished luk though feared mightie departeth litle season written one taking breath gathering new strength yea rather one chafed commeth eagerly fierce afterwards driue hold discomfort take thereby doth weaken courage labour wel gouerned liues small weake soeuer seemed bemat therefore haue tender conscience may rightly tearme trust therfore knowing confessing beloued hope wil suffer fall greatly keepe though see perswaded although falsely amisse thing ignorance vnbeliefe yet allowed commended meane euill said beloued god presumption let spoken weake christian onelylet stronger christian also vvell armed presumption although easily deceiued thus want knowledge sound experience let best also know falleth oft time one houre day men waxe somewhat carelesse vpholding faith good conscience commeth passe manie yeares feare danger thismat prou let know greatest measure faith doth bring answerable measure humilitie teacheth feare owne infirmity sathans crueltie obserue themselues lest fall hast smallest maner lay hold christ mercie walke presumptuously afterward let keepe well well rather boldly tempt god contrary let take remedie subtiltie diuell drawing presumption chap sathans hindering continuance faith thus passe another slie malitious practises beside tempting v vtter vnbeliefe presumption preuaile v neither wayes set selues haue bene taught vphold prop vp weake faith daily yet doth strongly assault v watching oportunities thereto may rooted stablished thereinthe diuell holdeth haue attained faith oft seeke much labour many prayer shall doubting time time held backe daily nourishing preseruing continuance heauenly gift liue grow sound experienced haue obtained god caused apostle pray thus though christ conuersant lord increase faith although commanded neuer cast away confidence come prayer duty time without faith oft pray day able call god father vnarmed while warfareephes yet preseruer life peace whereby benefit christ conueyed vnto v throughout life therefore doth hold haue inioyed felt sweetnesse possessing dailyit strange many christian heare must liue faith heb cor heb maketh harsh strange many euen god seruants heare righteous liue faith haue buried lost power operation life life accounted euen straunge vnbeleeuers heare must draw neare god assurance faith time hence among holy christian though weake must need say speech heard must euer beleeue daily hold faith though matter heard speech doubtfullrom yet scripture sheweth plainely must walke faith faith daily onely assurance iustification greater measure sanctification also life may liuing faith according apostle saith galathiansgal liue flesh mortall body liue faith sonne god hath loued giuen himselfe word manifest owne person sheweth faithfull vnited christ faith thereby draw sucke spirituall grace daily whereby liue say leade spirituall life rather christ liueth therefore iustification god people holinesse shew foorth liues arise hence beleeue god hath promised pet take heed faith faile strength waite saluation liue well must need follow faith failing men strength good thing vtterly faileth also therefore perswaded haue receiued grace beleeue thereby well inough though labour grow dailybut labour grovv hold fast thereby hope forgiuenesse sinnes grace grossely doth diuell bewitch v meanes soeuer whether keeping v ignorant truth otherwise busieth occupieth v world thinke looke whether holden way one although thing men world acquainted yet haue learned know excellencie beleeuing haue felt power working know neither liue comfortably thing well without heb without faith impossible please god people israell one part life daily rose vp perswaded wals iericho fall god foretold themios proose thereof euery day compasse blowing trumpet rammes horne beene commanded longer conflict iericho called prince world faith lie downe v rise vp v day accompany v nothing lamented thisthough little faith yet missed though rare seldome found earth diuell holding men vnbeliefe strongly band yet wanted missed godly themselues part scarcely haue great vse respect might haue neither point made familiar well knowne manie christian yet haue long time imbraced gospell euen good liking though greater experience better setled neither many grow see life continuall daily conflict sinne distrust neither acquainted subtile sleight diuell couertly bringeth passe forget purged sinnes therefore led deceiptfull allurement world speake see hardly holden daily strengthning nourishing faith yet haue truly though weakly tasted sweete christ thereby preaching gospell maruell cannot brought others yet weake also set delight therein best treasure found hauing comfort twenty thirtie yeares agone first heard receiued later yeares many doubted haue also dare vncharitable iudge otherwise say haue inioyed much comfort haue since inioyed stil cause sundry yeres past also haue sleight fruite sathan hath stolne away heart loue present thing euerie one way caused lose high estimation gospell though still commend wise inough meane obserue deceiued blindfolded misse coplaine losse while may liue ease prosper earth meane hath bin thus many therfore also others still hereby hath appeared death recouered decayed faith sundrie haue deeply descended theselues late done haue called remembrance season reioyced faith another maner latter dayes much bewailing also losse great benefit decay long time sustained eue great liberty mind walke god boldnesse freedom good conscience wise man saith cotinuall feastprou therfore see diuell pulleth fro darkning burying sure trust cofidence godhovv remedie let goeth couertly sun fro line aware wel looked say must learne put theselues forth cosider thee confounded therfore cry though thou kill v yet trust thee must leaue worldly wisdom whereby thought needlesse foolish nourish theselues daily must become fooles estimatio men may wise testimony clearly see god louing kindnesse daily one time know themselues continuall safetie thereby heart desire set lord alwaies theact may shaken shall snared sathans bads2 pet otherwise must need neither
