others confirming growing therein daily whether respect faith particular promise life life eternall last mentioned though sayd properly presume former yet hard hold good thing long letting loose heart much occupied world hauing many dealing also many company meeting many cross besides owne forgetfulnesse frailtie darkened distracted themselues feruent diligent vsing good meanes doubt feare estate many long profession vnder gospell sort people till settle themselues constantly walke god content keepe narow watch ouer heart liues better stay meanes preserue faith keepe peace god ordinarily see experience easily recouer themselues againe dimmed ouershadowed chap sathans hindring beleeuer liuing godly many wayes namely keeping wandring vnsetled course also remedie first occasion holdeth backe wicked followeth likewise shewed letteth beleeuers godly lifesatha hindreth godly life euen good christian feare god shall yet kept backe many duty would heauie wounded deceiuing sinnes afterward fill deadly discouragement holden vnder dangerous damnable let yet thinke themselues people godsathan letteth vnregenerate duty diuerse vvaies discouering way speake impediment hinder god child promised briefly set downe let whereby hindreth altogether practising godly life though thinke themselues sound christian yet liereuel may glory themselues haue cause nothing may know letted godly true christian indeed may know though sundry wayes letted yet like haue heart long accustomed euillthe first let hard see would enter sifting meanes cannot giue themselues ouer readie god one thing another thinke foolishnesse best performe outward taske prayer confession sinnes fashion feare like cause looking strength thereby whit godly neither action tied otherwise directed seemeth good themselues againe neither attaine sound cleare sight forgiuenesse sinnesthe second neither labour applying themselues promise god hope state good without life best bold presuming god mercy without warrant therefore either false confidence die whose estate yet cannot good else pleaseth god awake spirituall sleepepsal confesse truth plainely wofull estate third sam ioh psal therefore vnwilling enter consideration annoyance sin bringeth yet shall touch greatly trouble neither trie full action sinnes haue soone done matter though neuer wearie like speake forwardest sort vnrenewed fourthneither long perswaded saue onely good mood lasteth godly life onely happie life liue haue described namely haue conuersation heauen mind thing especially aboue while abiding earth strongly setled opinion part owne though may see vpon weake ground best course yet daily care holinesse irkesome go precise foolish full fantasy part accounted particular draw rule religion practise yet easily rest herein oft conscience nill telleth godly life best fift sixtto conclude either snared sect opinion aboue reach cannot stand godlinesse else ignorant god scripture incombrance enough hinder much entring godly course hollow looseminded wilfull none perswade better therefore comfort may easily coniectured rehearse infinite yea euen sufficient hinderance godly life soeuer found although put themselues foorth godly yet branded markes sathan shall sufficiently knowne farre would taken namely true christian remedie willing seeke referre first treatise booke wherein haue shewed way take deliuerred miserie let god people proceeding least godlinesse generally threenow proceed set downe let whereby god child holden practising godly life seeing many weake christian easilier tell hindred tell hindreth bodily sicknesse therefore lay open let whereby diuell doth chiefly stay hold backe going forward direct troubled may sort helped samethree generall let generally three particular shall referred either diuell keepeth wanting good thing without cannot constantly proceed godly life presseth downe euill thing inward outward sinnes take away courage godlinesse else vnsetleth occasion thing lawfull holden thereby christian life first general let containeth speciall letsof first sort set downe especially three vndertake mentio particular infinite rest discerned easily first isthe first diuell holdeth v setled course godlinesse godly ought liue daily though cannot breake altogether second want first louethe second though hold keepe course godlinesse many third isthe third want sufficient ministerie though troubled neither two former three way see much may greatly hinder v resolued consecrate selues wholly god liue indeuour nourish preserue feruencie first calling god wrought v holy sparckles quenched haue word god ordinarily blow vp chearish doubtlesse safest best way liue happily life inioyed although haue like measure grace experience meanes whereof cannot alike though voide forementioned let shall haue occasion shew namely trouble disquietnesse diuell raiseth weake yet deare seruants god occasion want grace others haue shew diuell hindreth vssathan hath absolute povver iob math pet meane hath absolute power authoritie himselfe god giueth triall punishment enemy power giueth doth cruelly subtilely malitiously exercise diligence may deceiue euen best destroy possible neither let aske thus deceiue bewitch v ground temptation owne weaknesse spirit hath accesse vnto spirit trouble long experience knowing nature practising miserie age age able ease worke annoyance respect giueth knowledge mind fully vnderstandeth least shew inclination affection knoweth heart perfectlyhe knovveth heart thought proper god onely long acquaintance nature adam day maketh onely expect outward signification speech gesture conceiue intent purpose also vniuersall corruption whereof hath continuall proofe discouer vanitie mind thought heart hath found setteth v forward seeth occasion whereto must inclne disobey god holy commandements returne let whereby diuell deceiueth simple shine light honour profession godly lifeyee first speciall let godly holinesse arising vvant tie themselues direction math psal phil first three sayd holding setled holy course example handleth matter many true hearted christian shall know thinke meete tie themselues rule order passing day leading life walke falleth generall care good meaning time whereas scripture teacheth v directed particularly thought word deed touching euerie commandement whole conuersation may beseeme gospell therefore passe day looke v go may caried care right performing duty seeth euen one sufficient let holden vnder able answer many action done offence god men day might haue bene experience haue cannot say one let remoued many euen giue good hope would well therefore blemisheth many action propound themselues course passing time framing liues point commendably example calling occupied labour religiously behaue themselues therein shewing patience ought haue occasion iustice innocencie walke feare god therfore find sweetnesse godly life yeeldeth whereas right good directing herein rather followe example others thinking well led commandement god warrant word therefore wisely foreseeing many wayes diuell go hinder euen soone broken good purpose made vnsetled againe whether ignorance folly pretence occasion whatsoeuer meane thereof diuell worker wiser deserue greater commendation former time season keepe obserue order direction leade liues haue learned holy scripturesit slightly done litle litle fall sleight common manner euen fashion great part rather custome shame waxe soone veary delight comfort heart go action constantly neither regard looke conscience one thing another may kept peace though cannot much blamed great euill yet inconstancie declining soone good beginning small blemish although lie long therein whereby doth see diuell watcheth narowly may spoile liberty bring sore danger although giue themselues know wrought neither marke letted put course much lesse preuent resist nay maruelled grossely deceiued grieued time letted glad haue excuse breaking againe distempered course fallen euill thereby yet know recouer fall afraid go recouerie god giueth inckling displeasure yet go forward till strike maine blowes become blockish vnder great affliction reade ionas fell asleepe notwithstanding sinneionas told great danger hang ouer like while secretly brought vpon people god thinke manifestly proue sathan hath beguiled while bringeth point doth greatly deface beautie godly life feare departed god vtterly returne though say go farre sound iudgemet yet much appalled former peace spirituall reioycing god portion become constancie watchfulnesse holy careheb strong confidence cast away feruent prayer fruitfulnesse sundry duty feele themselues neither fit company occupied calling without danger alone themselues thinke fruit lamentable want good thing sometime inioyed bare want shall best v haue while liue yet without peace vnsetled haue spoken vnsetle distemper diuell oppresseth may truly sayd one speciall kind let whereby hindreth going forward god people euen holding constancie stedfastnesse liuing godly day day renuing couenant god time time without grace possible free sore blemish inward vexation outward reproach thereby beloued lord farre although god tender kindnesse whereby keepeth vtterly forsaken keepe end although say goodnesse god turne good yet long securitie sleight seruing god diuell intending thing thereby dishonor god ouerthrow shall say none go aside way answer therefore necessarie warned thereof fenced may appeare maine let hindrance god people christian life destitute direction please god thereby vnsetled wander course liuing though certaine way appointed god remedie appointed godthe remedie brought light word inioyed practised sundrie faithfull seruants sometime kept voide enuious man euen many thousand still malice depriued thereof vnto day remedy first suffer selues easily perswaded speech commendation godly life generall wind except faithfully indeuour bring practise euerie dayis daily god haue escaped one bondage plungeth another holding vnder dreadfull feare distrustfulnesse shall perseuer end godly life especially sore trial persecution strong temptation shall come easily taketh feare soone strengthened confirmed cause sauiour forewarned disciple itmat saying feare kill body able kill soule rather feare able destroy soule body hellphil saint paule nothing feare aduersaries c cannot predominant feebleth vtterly power mind raising mudde springhovv letteth troubleth pure water consequently holdeth backe instrument body practising well kind dutie fetter therefore feare painefull irkesome streights holdeth escape begin reioyce hope againe yet shall attaine thereto grow therein distrusting themselues resting promise god deliuered feare much difficultie striuing yet shall litle litle word god soketh heart soft raigne hard ground must confesse passion troublesome much vnsetle v time feare sorow especially thing feare cause sorow deare pretious v apostle oppressed bothexample disciple onely scattering maister apprehension death though many perswasions strong reason prepared euen yet conuersant namely one time went iudea raise lazarus death answering sayd heard prouoke go thither maister iohn iewes sought lately stone thee doest thou go thither againe haue sayd except bene weary liues cause inough make vnwilling yea fearfull come vsthe example applied great comfort soeuer haue inioyed heauenly doctrine word god haue heard yet neuer receiued heare newes trouble comming towards v sudden taken oppressed yea though litle vnsetleth v present estate peace quietnesse wherein wholly possesseth sens scattereth former comfort neuer bene whereas lord hath end vnderpropped v strong consolation affliction come might better beare retaine peace word warned v sayd iohn besides many place thing haue sayd vnto iohn speaking comfortable doctrine taught middest tribulation ye may haue peace feare faintnesse therefore vnder crossehovv sathan troubleth v vvith let must know diuell strongly assault v thereby buffet v reproachfully reioyced yea boasted god fauor yet afflictons find deliuerance many time rather made ridiculous world thereby gazing stocke therein besides fainting owne hope rest insult ouer v extremity spared sauiour himselfe god let deliuer loue dearely else knowmat ye haue put trust bruised reed renounce therefore shift selues except ye miscarie helpe euen cursed instrument rabshakeh captaine king assyria perswade ezekiaes men trust depend god israell trouble hovv remoue heb therefore may find ease trouble let v gather strength faile neither resisted word sword must cut goliahs head faith hand must hold itpsal cor heb cor iam thus god saith word short trouble bring long comfort afterwards yee haue indured sent power may appeare weaknesse may haue proofe grace dwelling faith hope loue humblenesse obedience make world contemned fleshly lusts1 pet fight solues renounced may annoy v cure many disease carelesnesse high mindednesse much easetaking world rodde bringeth wisedomegen rom p al ho psal mat iosephs brother sayd suffer thing worthily sinned brother say sent good driue v feruently god cause v call yea make v happie while suffer like vnto christ himselfe called man sorrowes giue v matter reioycing therefore thankfull thempsal litle bewray vnkind dealing god vnwilling heare lesse great giftphil yea priuiledge vnto v apostle saith giuen christ onely ye beleeue also suffer sake vnquietnesse doth raise v refuse impatiently cast lord yoke feare farre greater suffering selfe therefore ought resolue selues see god shall suffer best v expedient christ sayd disciple depart themioh expedient golam therefore indeuour bow submit neckes vnto yoke praying power god seeth haue need of1 cor iam dan cor assuring selues helpe due time yea though sometime deferre call v suffer certainely succour deliuer v may find verified v written afflicted euerie side yet distresse persecuted forsaken cast downe perish meditation shall god goodnesse preseruatiue v affliction pet peter teacheth distracted feares vnsettle disquiet mind cast care vpon god careth phil effect saith saint paule nothing carefull pensiue thing let request shewed vnto god prayer supplication giuing thankes peace god passeth vnderstanding shall preserue heart sathan seeketh vnquietnesse take peace settle mind christ iesus god many men world agreeable salomon wordseccles haue seene euill sicknesse vnder sunne rich reserued owner thereof euill sinnes therefore like woe bring wisely carefully preuent auoid doth see great diligence must vsed shunning shall helpe good sort breake necke couetousnesse otherwise beare sway v howsoeuer name odious v haue rich plenty pooresinnes poorer sort rich may haue worldly mind well like couet discontented fret use vnlawfull shift come want whereby small hurt doth insue vnto whichhovv auoid true christian must learne resist withstand see allowance god affoordeth greedy appetite would desire besides meanes resist let labour calling diligently want haue much becommeth v well prouide hurt worldly good diuerse sinnes cause whereby vtterly disgrace profession thereby better way shall proue couetous arme selues al euils rich cause men commit excessiue loue beare great number haue set downe third remedie fourth last thisthe fourth remedie vve prouide vve bettered vvealth onely prouide hurt also looke carefully much bettered towards god seruice wanted although poore rich commanded consecrate themselues god yet may best haue helpes thereto deny psal vvealthy haue helpe godlinesse others time freedome religious exercise wealthy estate many helpes hereto found needie poore graunted sort feare god onely haue deale first haue time freedome exercise religion worship god publicke priuate meane may ofter inioy preaching word haue recourse reading christian conference good company meditation also prayer great helpes keeping setled course godlines hath bin set downe whereas poore besides shall looke themselues commendably discouraged made impatient want cannot part take benefit aforementioned helpes sort may obiect say indeed mayobiection worse wealth marke course wealthie day yea euen seeme religious benefit god rather draw away feruency forwardnesse godly life helpe theretoanswer answer sosuch bad vsers good thing sinne person vnthriftie vsers god blessing grosse vnthankfulnesse thereby prouoke take away bountie giue wrath heauie displeasure sure lord teacheth contrarie namely much bestowed much shall required end abundance good thing giueth v serue ioyfulnesse good heart deut indeed men go worke world haue receiued great rich god hand hard proue fruitfull let know account shall greater therefore obiection thus answered remaineth cleare without controuersie men haue receiued greater outward benefit god others may ought better godward iust cause care thought taking remoued poorer sort lie open good therefore must see selues haue receiued commodity many deare seruants wantas vve prosper outwardly see soules thriue hold profession hope ioy day day may say truly soules much well liking abundance necessary life haue else shall neuer able free selues blemish worldlinesse grace accompany three former v shall well declare nourish heauenly mind labour great sin coueting worldlinesse go rich v good beside haue spoke ofvvhat good rich may v luke make friend helpe v euerlasting habitation sauiour counselleth v saying make friend rich laying vp lord hand carefull bestow god poore saint thus giuing poore lend vnto lord put hand whatsoeuer lay shall plentifully payed v againe euen hundreth fold mar peace passeth vnderstanding life though alwayes rich againe world come eternall life yea verily act shall forgotten shall witness testimony faith giue beleeue liuing godheb plentifull rewarder seeke sauiour beleeue himreuel workes shall follow euen thus ourselues good therefore must thinke little selues oursmen make selues drudge child one day wished thus done good selues rather seruants yea slaues child prouiding greedily falleth dare scarcely take part good honest necessarie v lest thereby plucke therein verifying saying wiseeccles euill sicknesse point came shall go profit haue haue trauelled wind vaine nothing oh good many might good say others euen themselues carefull bestow well part haue place bewaile case neither haue men almost eares heare heart lament neglect duty conclude therefore last remedie couetousnesse worldlinesse monster many head euen good haue sayd might selues rich euery one seuerall estate able giue hath need receiuethe fruite remedy carefully looke seeth would chase away grossenesse daunger foule sinne therfore much remedy vsed man hurt good occasion shall offered hurt selues benefit soules may bold assure selues shall disgrace couetousnesse v one greatest mischiefes diuell worke v take heed man dealing might charge v iustly vnmercifulnesse iniustice owne conscience hand conuersation heauen gouerned heauenly rule may well go dealing earth seeing snare vaine set hath wing therefore flying mounting wing watching meditation prayer ouer snare layd shall safely auoid teacheth alteration change euery death otherwise layd heart seriously thought doth much quaile pride life v therefore also weane v loue world contempt second reason seeing rich world owneriches ovvne borrovved luke borrowed sauiour christ saith ye haue bene faithfull another man good giue likeneth thing man borrowes neighbour see man maketh reckoning another body good substance valew estate counteth himselfe neuer richer oweth euer pay backe honester man carefull restore flourish beare another man good occupie required called neither part wise man one loueth quietnesse peace v busie selues endlessely griply wealth though proper heritage owner euery day calling it1 tim madnesse counted yet owne smaller rich godlinesse great though occupied many thing yet one necessarie tim goeth fearefull sinnes occasion otherwise haue bene bold lastly whether haue bene furthered euerlasting life see may deale behaue selues earthly commodity shall thinke good steward disposers owner lord may able see vse estate aright sauiour saith diuell mat stealeth word men heart haue heard whether poore rich although teach walke one contentation lowlinesse good workes yet neither whit better christian direction daily shall easily brought feare withstand like occasion disguise making seeme men feare god wherein specially must looke selues wisely auoide preuent occasion seeing know haue smarted cannot altogether auoide yet arme selues resolute couenant feruent prayer haue bene ouercome must see marke weaknesse pray earnestly giue ouer god grace shall sufficient v quiet mind hope pardon weaken sinnes afterwards impediment constant holding godly lifevvhat obseruations gathered doctrine let may seene idle occupation true christian continue worke ceremonious tasking himselfe reading prayer thing think good inioyned yet litle labour costeth men would neglected oftthe first minister people tied itthe second also may see need seruants god haue guard themselues strongly abide hath bene shewed acquainted sathans craft pollicies mean repelled resistedthe third temptation somtime forcible subdued ouercomethe fourth giue fall open sinne cause s2 cor paul admonisheth men quench spirit thes yea sinne repentance end may rise againe remedy appointed lord himselfe behalfe may see therefore tossed ship waues seathe fift sometime aloft vaine hope confidence safe good estate yet nothing time cast downe plunged depth bottome feares yea dispairing estate peter neither forsware maister thought could haue bene pardoned miserie euer part caried well stayed fast setled faith hope extremity yet thing admirable neuer safer thus exercised yron vnoccupied doth soone waxe rustie stone lieth still couered mosse examining obseruing themselues considering state watching ouer heart foreseeing danger comming learning experience thing past like maner occupied time present waxe barren vnprofitable euen best time breake dangerously estate safer thus exercised would themselues put course neither weary though depriue themselues many liberty thereby desire hold constantly well fenced safe course added may haue grace sufficient themthe sixt furthermore impediment like many sore faithfull may see beholding god deeply indebted rage violence temptation yea sore sometime may commit sinne presumptionpsal kind dispairing yet god sendeth calme againepsal deliuerance deepest sorrowes feares iacob wrastled angell hurt would depart til blessed euen seruants god haue conflict lord himselfegen keepeth downe one hand holdeth vp may exercise faith may vnoccupied last doctrine let faith godlinesse child god shine clearly may see behaue themselues striuing sin going vnder affliction wicked loade lord layeth themexod psal iob murmure rebell haue greatest suffering striue trust measure strengthened greater power christ ioyfulnes col also though feele power rebellion sinne well otherpsal c prou yet hate perfite hatred would drawne coardes looke god mercy christ would let go hold sinne tast thereof sweet breake feare god wrathmath neither lay hold indeed pardon obseruations god seruants may make doctrine let many singular benefit say infinite almost say might sayd like purpose remaineth word put mind acquaint themselues better better christian life daily delight solace themselues meane one part hath great varietythe great remedy howsoeuer fall many difficulty liues yet know shall fewer weaker themselues grow knowledge stronger faith grace although brought yeeld themselues many darke mist cast eye extenuate make small sinnes commit hiding punishment couertly obiecting mercy god yet let know haue committed shall aggrauated fast side mercy god let remembred occasion prouoke sinning shall neuer wanting place shall ministred rather euen thing euill owne nature hath beene sayd shall fit disposition euery man yea euen assembly god people may bold time cast feare danger let fight good fight faith lay hold eternall life follow good helpe haue receiued learned god though find comfort time desire feare present striuings conflict yet dare assure lord hauing spoken know happie fruite end seemeth greatest miserie shall reape fruit christian life doth litle helpe haue communion also selues helper others either require duty v bashfulnesse dare bold simplicity cannot yet seeing stand need counsell direction loue shew haue learned behalfe purposed hope great fruite communion auoide strangenesse breaketh profit betwixt v giueth feare secret conceiptednesse much loue wanting direction read ouer shall see cause may coueniently mind desirous wel see amisse v also faithfulnesse vse remedy may bold lord working meanes assure selues shall labour herein vaine haue attained hereto determined rest directed still rule god word doth minister v hauing set downe remediesperswasions vse direction may raise vp selues declinings godly life added reason perswade v thereto much may sure hinderance discouragement inough shall meete v withhold v first thisthe first course seeking walke god former remedy direct v vnto brought sweet holy communion lord comparison whereof nothing desired honor prerogatiue world neither knoweth neither attaine vnto get principalitie ouer prince world diuell obtaine grace owne euill heart well ruling greater honour subdue kingdomes also hereby haue libertie godly boldnesse come lord complaint prayer assured whatsoeuer shall aske according shall granted v peace comfort hereby great none hath euen tasted would chaunge estate conscience men beaten disquieted hellish fearefull torment case man need feare malicious accusation hath bene circumspect looking wayes therefore deseruedly euill speech take hold seeing carefull please god cannot iustly incurre rebuke men euil tidings free feare hath armed himselfe looke hardest like state al thing considered shall found richest part best portion must feede themselues folly take fill vanitie till miserie ouertake mid way destruction meete litle thinke vpon moreouer howsoeuer indeuouring godly lifethe second perswasion hath euer world bene litle regarded yet happiest men greatest commendation godlinesse haue alwaies preferred made flower garland crowne reioycing haue cloud witness one age haue walked god euen enoch thereabout day testified daily looking liues best thing like perswasions brought like itan admonition caueat faithfully couenanted selues vse remedy haue bene set downe continuance make beginning sound substantiall may able beare vphold waight shall presse downe although temptation strong many yet may none preuaile thus farre make v breake happie couenant strongly armed shall easily find hinderance enough arise quickly weaken power best purpose frustrate haue taken hand inward let come way many sort thinke needeth liue thus also many godly thus inordinate loue speciall sinne may withhold v much dulnesse vnprofitablenesse rebellion may make v vtterly vnable hold foorth course many outward discouragement may perceiue without great sweetnesse delight go reason hereof fleshly heart like good thing long therefore either two wayes depriue selues benefite growing forward forenamed remedy negligent vsing leauing yet fault must quickly espied long lyen dangerous easily beleeued better attaining hereof may vnderstand may grow commonnesse good thing two wayes either prosperity estate hard see great need easie v go forward although set vpon againe one time shall like driuen backe iudgement fearefull aboue many next vnto despaire must thinke lord dealeth tenderly v may haue libertie glorifie manifold reprooue israell seruing ioyfulnesse gladnesse deu kindes particular calling whereby god teacheth grace laboured particular calling husbandman artificer magistrate preacher may walke vocation oxe onely belly sake seruing god worke men knowing thiscol may mery euen finde delight heauenly life flying corrupt behauiour bad example world much contentation freedome feare carnall gospeller eie coueteth soule longeth would desire euen psalmist saith greater pleasure would wish better thing desireps pleasure earth compared wisdomeluc perswaded god seruice perfect freedome sound pleasure walke say trueth life must need mopish tedious thus doe goe vntowardly forward froward seruant sent goeth awkely businesse god making delight pleasure v may set heart thereupon fit minde wholly part principally aboue matter yet knew better wholly take v vp affect v treasure heartmat looke man delighteth oft euery come remembrance thought vpon meanes tedious wearisome sometime cheefest matter al possesseth v therefore prophet god would certaine place speake delight statute god addeth fruit thereofps continually remembrance forget thus commeth passe many god servant may seene drawen vp vnto god speech behauiour whole course bend way minde heauenly thingshebr wise maruell thereat cause resolutely perswaded labour lost way yea rather pleasantest estate finde delight therein therefore need others whose heart strongly carried strange desire god guiding may set thing heauenly seeing haue made delight ioy oh weigh exceeding priuiledge praier practise duty whereto sometime vntoward onely euen rebellious willingly taken hand become pleasure stead deadly toile yea freedome liberty make trade aime seruing god thing farre knowledge serueth v godly way become easie daily regarded waxeth pleasant euen old delight meane lust ignorance grow loathsome thought impossible yet concerning rebellion contradictionthe godly much troubled rebellion though serue god ioy void liberty inlargement holden captiues thereof great part shall said afterwards else haue heauen heere may espy giue rest hearty mislike oppose themselues fight haue sweetnesse pleasure christian life therefore gainesaying lust rebell course striue hold neither forceable haue beene neither doe long time wont hold vnder haue said remainder sinne rebellion nature abiding still best god seruants would haue well marked many ready take occasion otherwise cauill quarrel haue said namely god hath giuen priuiledge liberty serue delightobiection thus reason goe forward thus easily christian life take pleasure many godly people toile seemeth hindered clogged rebellion old man corrupt nature force strength extinguished killed whereas scripture tell v farre otherwiseps rom best men euer borne maner men felt smarted complained therefore say set v christian found answerebut answere somewhat fully stirring rebellion old man corruption naughtinesse cleaueth fast vnto v many degree farre exceed greatest measure holinesse possibly reach vnto although denie grace god haue attained somwhat already serue god delight may god glorified part sinne sticketh fast v doe perfectly continually without intermission euen likewise v fountaine spirituall leprosie whereas finde vncleannesse heart imperfection weaknesse euen best action say nothing common although delight goe forward duty god men yet weake knowledge killed strength extinguished say thing abated indeed weakned much aswell pardoned grace power wee receiue dailie lord iesus christ faith answere vnto former obiection whereby may clearely seene meane finde pleasure greatest reioycing subduing euill heart forgoing vnlawfull liberty men fight tooth naile would count life worse death except might inioy nay high degree honour may day day admitted reioyce lord duty doe euen shall set hand vnto yet others farre itnote would chuse lie prison day life rather would thus yoked account therefore praise lord ye seruants lord say doth wonderfull thing otherwise precious soeuer themselues yet thinke shall well contentnote euerie light occasion omit neglect sleightly houerly passe ouer testifiea sleight formall vsing meanes profit shall get good common sort haue lost beautie v shall lose fruit consider say lord giue thee vnderstanding knowen profanest proudest contemner godthe beautie worship god glorious armeyes prophane person beholde seldome onely fashion doth pray heare sermon help whereby grow constant christian life little account glorious woorthy reape profit commeth light esteeming causeth set vnsauourinesse findeth wearinesse causeth commend highly admire lord kindnesse maketh sweet gainfull gall wormewoodthat common priuilege otherwise could properly called priuiledges like precious good bad good reckoning onenote euill sort perswaded thus therefore finde nothing either know help may truely said doe yet know vse faith especially may say constantly one day another one aswel another may go better soules thereby thinke though vse great matter doe vse though ceremonie neuer houerly thinke euen cause highly please god maner vsing neuer able proue fruit benefit may reaped beleeue may know rightly practise themwho constant seruice god though full weakly time looke fruit inioy see blessing giueth v therof doth great end may haue better experience manie way keepeth promise v inricheth v waxe constant therein hardly withdrawen occasion holding say may although griefe may spoken many euen v farre inioying libertie might let know owne sinne cannot therefore praise god sweet helpe better therefore shut vp point let perswaded god faithfull seruants hath singular fauour giuen help settle christian life great prerogatiue priuiledge therefore vnder colour weaknesse yeeld waiwardnesse heart soone vntoward gracious help wearie must repent vnthankfulnesse nourishing fleshly libertie shaketh needfull dueties shall shew selues wise though world count v fooles good saftie danger shall great would haue proceeded lay foorth christian reader priuiledge place would fitly come god hath surely prouided thus farre beautified blessed shall thus continue vnto end seeing last inioyed life shall haue last place among temporall priuiledges yet thought amisse mention thing stay hearing blessed beginning proceeding would glad heare end answerable also may looke place assigned chap sixth priuiledge namely right vsing prosperitie next priuiledge thinke may fitly ioyned former lord hath taught right vse prosperitie aduersity may cary themselues peace vpright estate two principall part slipperie estate rich honour health friend lawfull pleasure profit liberty life doe deceiue vndoe greatest part world inioy possesse yet beloued lord may free dangergod teacheth stand slipperie way meane haue right vnto earthly thing christ heires blessing world therefore doe soberly ought vse many euen confesse farre therefore want labour helpe person may perswaded brought right vse outward liberty wicked god draweth heart thereunto mighty power whereby able doe thing teacheth itfor causeth doctrine taught contempt world contentation estate moderation sobriety lawfull pleasure profit c imprinteth heart holy ghost maketh able beleeue spoken themfirst scripture therefore apply themselues maketh prooue doctrine worketh try themselues see themselues haue gone beyond bound may returne act easy make man forget mortality see nabucadnezzar herode others yet scripture giueth greater grace daniell iob others determined set heart besides benefit scripture god causeth hisalso experience wicked doe oft finde feele themthey bring also vpon themselues outward trouble sinnes therefore shew outward trouble many christian doe well sinne trouble incomber liues kinde sinne wilfull blindnesse carelesnesse vnbrideled affection euen well men vtterly vnreformed doe bring vpon themselues shame sutes law pouerty debt disease imprisonment loss ill report wicked posteritie c like sure ignorantest abode within prison walles great many might well reckoned vp would say must need trouble world yet seeth like drawne vpon many christian sin sore correction god seeing may easily want care watchfulnesse oft offend thus true might well auoided sinne taken heed resisted labour watchfulnesse vnruly heart subdued neither let answer cannot attained affirmegod giueth grace ouercome sinnes god giueth grace vnto fraile men whereby may atteined teacheth many god haue glory thereof comfortably finde hate seruants sinne although cannot walke without sinne receiue wage sinne iniquitie others doenote say let considered ease peace freedome many trouble sort men inioy liues others goe without sorrow calamity fill day themselues many others might voide many haue ignorantly thought trouble cannot auoided haue said many might shunnedwhat quiet finde liues liues might many way sundry respect pleasant quiet causeth see thus diuers christian yet trouble well owne folly procuring causeth say farre loue true religion whose sakenote doe make owne liues comfortable abstaine offence seeing woe pronounced otherwisemath certainly come vpon vpon v woe causeth another fall obiectionbut men ready excuse answere themselues saying cannot alike cannot doe may obiection vnlesse pure simplicity signe rather goe forward seeke recoueranswere whatsouer whose soeuer answer let weake indeauour follow forasmuch wicked may haue part well bring example proouethe godly deliuered god fauour god people may sure fatherly loue deliuer many namely haue sought vnto god trouble god say creature assuring themselueshos hath smitten shall heale haue vsed meanes deliueranceester chro god hath taught vse namely fasting praier confidence mardocheus iehosaphat haue rested vpon god psalme brused reede ofttimes israell doe looke deliuerance certainly haue first promise thereof godiosua iudg iosua king hazor company gedeon amalekites midianites doe say obtaine deliuerance thus maner singular priuiledge vnto know commeth god therefore may haue great comfort therein receiue deliuerances pledge fauour wicked soand thus god seruants onely deliuered trouble vngodly haue part fellowship yet doe say euen alwaies thus affected furnished grace alwaies beleeue looke ityet godly doe alwaies beleeue oft god deliuereth daungers trouble indeed daily aime yet haue sound comfort heart men haue vnlesse doe thus waite vpon god sound hope seeke necessity distress maner haue onely outward helpe succour end trouble wicked may haue little considering whence come whether haue god fauour displeasure goe must heere answer obiection wil demaunded meobiection profit may reape example alleadged whereby proouedobiection deliuerances aduersities danger priuiledges except haue promise thereof god beforethe father particular promise haue beleeue v men say forasmuch god doth time speake vnto v age past vnto father iehosaphat indeed say might well easily perswaded2 chron god would giue moabites enimies hand prophet said morrow goe themios iudg lord thee iosua like maner gedeon hath god thus spoken faithfullest seruants last age world parsonally particularly trouble say deliuer remoue affliction therefore none certaine thereof therefore well ordered trouble answereanswer god doth indeed speake v maner father certified epistle ebrewes2 tim hebr hath left whole minde v word wherein hath fully declared thing sufficient weightiest matter hath spoken plainely v concerning one thing namelygod chiefest matter hath spoken plainly v rom iam deliuering v distress affliction inward sinnes corruption hath promised beleeue giue v grace mortifie sinne doe ouercome subdue would yet grace shall sufficient v best forfathers outward visitation cross sickness pouerty c hath promised also expedient best v pull v themiohn rom howsoeuer doe suffering doth shall best v thing said body church former g generall promise made faithfull excepting especiall cause particular promise deliuerence made certaine person waighty cause yet made times2 sam trouble may seene answere dauid driuen ierusalem sonne absolon rising vp traiterously vnnaturally said vnto zadok priest carry arke god againe city shall finde fauour eies lord bring againe shew tabernacle thereof thus say haue delight thee behold heere let doe seemeth good eies cleare dauid trouble know whether god would deliuer neither know end promise god returne againe ierusalem peace behold arke tabernacle yet dauid sought lord humbled himselfe amased affliction strange remembred lord praied worshipped token made god stay defence whatsoeuer issue sore triall like seene example sidrach misach abednego heard straight charge king nabucadnezar whosoeuer sound instrument musicke fall downe worship image set vp cast midst hot fiery furnace immediately answered king said nabuchadnezar dan carefull answere thee matter behold god serue able deliuer v hot fiery furnace deliuer v thy hand king knowen vnto thee king wil serue thy god worship golden image thou hast set vp see knew whether god would deliuer perswaded tender fatherly care ouer would shew time need glory would deliuer c returne selues tribulation thus vpholden generall promise god sue seeke condition deliuered expedient eies indeauouring contented shall fall either sidenote haue behaued selues became v haue sought aright word teacheth v obtaine deliuerance god hath heard v hath kept promise v haue receiued good proofe faith deny great priuiledge obtaine deliuerance thus thus although deliuered yet rest perswaded howsoeuer weake nature hold backe lord hath done iustly well hoping confidence fraile flesh may obtained answerable strength consolation vnto measure affliction greatest neede men see great matter let wade little deeper weigh vpholden faith fall shift vnlawfull meanes otherwise see way escape vnbeleeuers doe1 sam iona sam math p iona namely saule waiting vpon lying vanity forsooke god goodnesse neither striken deadnesse nabal heard heauy tidings distrust dispaire iudas neither complaining murmuring god owne child sometime vpholden faith forced doe yet haue deliuerance way carnall pollicie subtill shift like doe deny meanes may come farre count priuiledge matter reioicing maketh affliction double yea tenfold thereby maner none thus conclude point affirming singular prerogatiue v may kept fro many trouble altogether cannot freed lesse honour priuiledge fauour may deliuered many others shall deliuered haue shewed prooued present point yet onely priuiledge haue said may deliuered vse vnlawfull meanes looke thus god see good expedient therefore doe waite patiently vntill send issue grace vnbeleeuers neuer haue neither haue onely god child capable euen inioy either neuer hauing learned soundly cleerely beleeuing may possiblie attaine causeth much vnchearefulnesse discontent c trouble grudging god yea indirect shift auoid much hollownesse coldnesse negligence seruice god christian cariage selues trouble themselues constrained confesse lord teacheth people make vse afflictionsiohn pet euery one may also learne wise enough thinke resolued exceeding benefite profit sendeth neuer till frame addresse contrary way vtterly vnwilling beare euen discouraged heauy hearted oft thinke wisdome therefore must sought euen good seruants godluc looke daily ready receiue god must suppresse checke contrary power carnall reason otherwise way time annoy followeth therefore next consequently declare poore people god may come wisdome shew guideth make profitable good vse cross chastisement able doe saint whosoeuer forsaketh house brother sister father marc mother wife child land sake gospel shall receiue hundredfold present world come life euerlasting say beside ala poore life lead heere haue great store pleasure commodity religoius yet haue haue much sorrow feare vnquietnesse though haue lawfully come yet besides vncertainty life selfe reproch vnkindnesses malice ill disdaine better lewd tongue inferior repining emulation equal wearyings v sort vnto subiect shrinking going backe hearing persecution death confesse communion saint haue world god church nothing weight mooue christian desire liue heere especially lord calleth hence yet forgoing god presence world recompenced largely inioying life come alwaies preferred best estate may heere inioied oh least peece misery seeing little good may done v heere contrarily great cause complaining haue led law member many way euill able say euery day come lord iesus come quickely reu desire dissolued christ end discourse seeing god hath taught child prouide hardest may perseuer good course vnto end euen great tribulation persecution much haue easier passage without let holden greatest rest haue singular prerogatiue granted godro thereby may say reuerence confidence nothing shall separate v god neither life death neither thing present thing come let honor liberty lost good world cannot redeeme buy againe therefore let v nourish daily hope perseuerance first keeping v willingnesse die sometimes doe shall fit liue secondly vse oft meditate vanity thing contempt world set mindes thing heauenlycol may preserue continue liberty thirdly hold worketh loue praise god owne comfort brought passe security negligence while giue al possible diligence hereuntoforwardest must paternes others set themselues good order daily direction preseruing others practise experience haue found mightily god hath blessed estate ready rest desire haue prooued possible yea easie god maketh passe day well peace worst free euill part rather wearisomely vnwillingly doe let pattern example forward let one learne another meekenesse spirit hath yet attained vnto hold opinion none doe themselues doe goe beyond yet haue scarcely slightly gone practise themselues reason serue god day falleth venture without certaine purpose carethe idle may looke gaine painfull professor experience haue liues note vsing meanes quickening faith either finde godly life easie able iudge best way haue painfully trauelled spent much time must able report repulse haue haue recouered strength againe temptation haue resisted hinderance discouragement whereby haue beene long held backe haue ouercome must able say hardnesse godly life made easie flitting soone vanishing faith strengthened confirmed comfort vnspeakeable peace god giueth incourage goe forward constantly must haue good proofe many infirmity send earnestly god praiers strengthen short must acquainted subtile malicious practises diuill seducing falshood deceiuablenesse owne heart haue withstood deadly loathsome broad way wicked walke though onely seeme pleasant honour haue saint grace bestoweth vpon seeke truethmat p god hath thus trained made fit seruice shall finde great ease reward seruing god finde proofe exceeding benefit daily direction well ordering liues yea shall count themselues much vnsetled day shall passe consecrated god sort wish learne wayweake learne others scripture consequently maiestie god knowing best v hath thought good thus direct v yet ala common many goe good christian may see griefe though god giuen time offend liberty worde condemned make saie vnsaie denie affirme thing say though thus euerie small occasion let loose raine licentiousnesse yet denie doe many thing commendably doth auaile dead fly doe cause stinke putrifie ointment apothecarieeccles ill part life dead fruites mixed commendable vertues spoile vertue beautie haue fauour sight god neither giue sweet smell sauour vnto men leauen though little doth sower leauen whole lumpe dough strong corruption suffered beare sway life doe corrupt euen otherwise would good bleamish deformitie nature see man body one eie legge small great proportion agreeablenesse liues betwixt one part another vtter deformitie whole thinke harde bound saie bring particularity liues vnder examination themselues held within compasse anie rule debarre anie libertie shall thinke good foolish thinke necessarie seruile obey follow let remember said willing duty let heare meliberty sinne dangerous seruitude lately set stopping course flesh owne corrupt affection yet liue afterrom shall die cut inheritance god christ indeed meanes bridle many passion pride loftinesse swelling breake many boisterous outrage rise vp v wrath frowardnesse heartburning quench manie fierie dart concupiscence vncleane lust wantonnesse fonde dangerous delight lead men destruction cleare liues season tongue christian talke well clense heart man reioiceth name christian would haue libertie euils say libertie nay would become bondman speake properly truely bondage highest degree owne intemperate affection desire varietie good libertieswe may vse good liberty mercifull god hath betrusted v manie comfortable themselues may vse lord god haue honour thereby while take part lord may lose part due worde while vse soberly care offend nothing done knowledge peace therein sufficient enough men lord sure men cannot content keepe themselues staie pay dearely euery stolne libertie must say haue mindes satisfied godly life excelleth sing dolefull song haue learned somewhat late wofull experience measure treasure mirth end doe see christian haue walked good course time haue begun shake yoke obedience haue againe sought libertie flesh alledging must alwaies pent looke way see say god hath houre dayfalles good christian boldnesse giuen vp owne hand haste rashnesse run greedinesse fulfilling heart desire haue sought one houre lay foundation sorrow many yeeres haue afterwards like haste ease returned againe nay must haue shewed themselues wiser wise strong sampson strongest time prostituted made himselfe sot slaue base mistresse recouered himselfe againe vntill ground prison like horse eies put seruing make vncircumcised pastime beene ioy glory people god returne sampson haue tried hath gained owne hand libertie while haue thereby runne shamefull sinnes offence thousand griefe may witnesse trueth say miserable experiencetrue libertie sound comfort libertie desired rested euery one seeke contented libertie god giueth himprou remembring written good conscience continuall banquet know frailtie forgetfulnesse remainder corruption best shall oft go way therefore need seeke occasion doe auoid rather obey commandement god put ye lord iesus rom make prouision flesh fulfill lust thereof trust may suffice vnfolding forenamed scripture answere reasonable man full contentation let feare god cease maruelling carefull please god euen day one day aswell another besides reason proper place haue set downe weighed christianitie like trade occupationchristianitie must followed el good come wherein good done profit arise except thorowly followed great diligence especially point regarded one thing lost neglected while another followed one duetie slacked while another performednote thus shut vp answer last obiection saying forementioned scripture like fearefull god child neither shall need trouble take heed trouble themselues wilfulnesse grosse negligence simplicity heart shew themselues teachable know god although finde many want themselues groane vnder burden truely cast downe sin haue committed best vnder better condition although may excell brother measure grace therefore confesse haue done allluc vnprofitable seruants chap obiection minister may follow daily direction yet therefore people obiect better counsell giuen authour himselfe follow answer larger answere first obiection chapter obiections remaine shall word answered one though haue nothing trouble sit quiet study leade scholar life may fit guide selues maner heere hath beene set downe indeed becommeth well doe looke hand light vnto others yet therefore vrged vpon vsnot onely minister yea obiecters alledge hard euen scolars minister obserue haue many help set forward ouer haue small equitie inioined performance duetie required hinderance let world farre greater help furtherance fewer weaker ye know answer help learned ministerie fewer let part haue liuing prouided may much free ought earthly intanglements others except loue haue hand head ful worldly dealing haue dueties performe besides common priuate christian ought rest direction aforesaidministers like tend common euery priuate beleeuer according speciall calling minister ought performe seuerall dueties thereof publickly foundation ruine many chap second general head treatise heart heart fountaine godly life must first purged like heart like life heart dungeon iniquity simile view filthinesse heart men see therefore suspect danger purging heart dieth weake estate shalbe saued holy desire oft time quenched beleeuer reuiue heart purged power holy ghost first turning sinner god euen gracious worke must stand stay heart purged faith worldly delight sought heauenly felt soone assured god fauour soone heart changed faith purgeth onely instrument true repentance without change heart amendment life simplest christian findes measure proofes change wrought faith change beleeuer sensibly descerneth present estate former weake troubled change small yet note state good change heart foundation godly life men
